loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa G. is from the village of Talisay. She is 33 years old. Nelfa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelfa runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nelfa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nelfa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the third loan taken out by Nelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support the education of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Meling

texts.en:
Meling V. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase cassava flour to sell. Meling is 27 years old and married to a soldier. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school and provide them with enough scholastic materials.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Nargis Group

texts.en: Nargis is the leader of this group, which has six members. Each member is seeking a loan to expand their business, so they are requesting a group loan of 60000 Afghani. Nargis and Jameil are seeking funding to expand their husbands' taxi services.  Aliah wants to take a loan for the business of quilt making. Sheela and Shokori would like a loan for their husbands' general stores. Nadara wants a loan for the business of carpet weaving. The group members thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Нуралиев Рустам проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Рустам более 2 лет занимается перевозками людей, т.е. предоставляет услугу такси. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины, т.к кредит является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Rustam N. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 28 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Rustam has been involved in passenger transportation, i.e. he provides a taxi service. He is requesting a loan for vehicle repairs because credit is his only source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a mother, Erlinda wants to meet the needs of her only daughter. Thus, she and her husband really work hard to support the family's needs. The couple own a motorcycle transport business, from which they earn an income that is just enough to support their basic necessities. Aside from the motorcycle transport, Erlinda also manages a variety store in their house. Her income from the store is being utilized for the education of her child, who is currently enrolled in the elementary level of education. 

With her desire to replace the old parts of their motorcycle, she decided to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos from ASKI. She knows that the amount will be of great help to her family and for her variety store, as she also plans to use some of the loan for buying commodities for the store to gain more customers. She said that she wants to save little by little for the education of her daughter.

loans.use: Buying motorcycle parts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to earn a living and to meet the needs of her family. She is 44 years old and married with three children. All her children are in school. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is married and has a child. She is 39 years old. She sells provisions at her house. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. T. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as earrings, necklaces and shell decorations in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 8,600 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Atoma

texts.en:
Atoma I. is currently in the business of selling maize flour at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase Irish potatoes and onions to sell. Atoma is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children who both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy beans, simsim (sesame) and many other items to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase Irish potatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Charmilyn

texts.en:
Charmilyn C. is from the village of Bacnor East, Burgos, Isabela, and is happily married to Reynaldo. They are gifted with two children as fruit of their love. Their main source of income is farming, but it is not suitable for emergency cases when it is not time for harvesting. Charmilyn operates her own business direct selling  Avon, Natasha, and MSE cosmetics and apparel products. At the same time, she sells frozen food for an extra source of income. She looks for customers around her village to buy her products.

Her husband works in their fields. Their yield serves them for their children's expenditures in school. Her husband also works for someone else for extra income if he has time. Sometimes Charmilyn is also doing activities in their fields to help her husband. At present, her customers are increasing but her capital is insufficient to supply all her customers' orders. She wants to have more income because her family expenditures have increased. She wants to borrow the amount of 13,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders to be able to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jenifer's Group

texts.en:
Jenifer M. is married and cares for her five children and three nephews. She is the leader of her group in Rukungiri. Her husband is in jail, so the responsibility of providing for the household solely falls to her. She has had much success in her business enterprises and, through her plantations and animal husbandry operations, generates 170,000 USH in profits per week.

Jenifer would like to use the loan amount to purchase two more cows for her dairy operation. She hopes that one day with the continued success of her business, she will be able to buy more land and have a larger farm.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie B. is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has been in business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase tailoring materials. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Kerija

texts.en:
Kerija H. is currently in the business of selling cassava and sweet potatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase carrots and Irish potatoes to sell. Kerija is 28 years old and is married, with a husband who is a clerk. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a building that she will use as a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase carrots and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 39 years old. He was a soldier and he is married to Ma. Luisa A., a full time housewife. They have two kids: Carl Luis Ferdinand who is 7 years old and in grade 1 and Sonia Ysabel who is one year old. They are living harmoniously at Cabaruan, Cauayan City Isabela, one kilometer away from the national highway. His internet cafe is located at Cabatuan Road. 
He has operated an internet cafe for almost seven years. His weekly net income is PHP 2,000.00. His wife also has an electronic load station for cell phones inside his internet cafe. He applied for a loan amount of PHP 25,000.00, for additional capital to be able to make his business productive. As a loving and industrious father to his family, he wants to earn more income in order to support his family, especially financially, for their better future in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for his internet cafe

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D. C. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 63 years old. Monica is widowed and has adult-aged children. To make a living, Monica sells a variety of personally used products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Monica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Monica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 35 years old and married with five children. She sells Garri and provisions very close to her house. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Rhoda's Group

texts.en: K. Rhoda is a hard working and determined lady. She is 38 years old and married with four children, two in secondary school and two in primary school. She takes care of one other dependant. She has a retail shop in Bukari Cell Kashenshero that she has been running for six years and she is able to make 120,000/= profit a month. This is because there is a lot of competition. She started her retail shop using her personal savings from teaching and she does not regret it. She has learned to take care of her customers with her good customer care skills. She hopes to grow the business much bigger and the family will be much happier. Rhoda needs a loan to help expand her business by purchasing more stock since this will bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions, clothes and drinks. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions, clothes and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic and her husband Fredie have been married for eight years. They have two children: Jomar, 17 years old, who stopped his schooling because of financial constraints, and Jerome, 10 years of age, a grade IV student at Villa Concepcion Elementary School. Her family lives at Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. 

She operates a general store in their village. Her daily net income is PHP 500. The couple's other sources of income are gasoline retailing, and corn farming. According to Marivic, they really work hard for the education of their children. They hope that Jomar will able to attend school again. In connection with that, Marivic applied for a loan from ASKI of PHP 6,000 for her to purchase more commodities for her business. She hopes that KIVA will grant her requested loan so she can earn more income.

loans.use: Addtional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phaste and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts and make phaste to sell.  

Agnes is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock maize, shorgum and many other cereals to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Roya Group

texts.en:
Roya is the group leader of the Roya Group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress their businesses and make them larger. 

Roya wants to take a loan for her brother, who has a general store. Soma wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a shop for selling fruits and vegetables. Farden wants to take a loan for a vegetable-selling shop. They requested a group of loan 30,000 Afghani and they are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Glendy

texts.en:
Glendy D. R. is from the village of D. Carmen Iligan City. She is 20 years old. Glendy is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Glendy sells "RTW" clothing in the local community. Glendy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. (Picture was taken at the store of Monica Dela Cerna)

In 2009, Glendy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glendy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glendy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night R. is currently in the business of selling textbooks, pens, exercise books etc at the bookshop and is requesting a loan to purchase a photocopying machine. 

 Night is 25 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up an internet café.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Salimbal, Lugait Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Rosalinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in their village. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In October 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service like nail polish  and more. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a 48-year-old married woman with nine children. She sells provisions and rechargeable phone cards within her community. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Wilhelma

texts.en:
Wilhelma D. C. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 62 years old. Wilhelma is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Wilhelma raises native chickens for sale. Wilhelma is just starting this business.

In 2007, Wilhelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilhelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Wilhelma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Wilhelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Benon's Group

texts.en: Benon Korusherura is 45 years old and married with eight children, ranging in age from 20 years to 5 years. All of his kids are enrolled in school. Benon has been a fisherman for over 20 years and has recently opened up a grocery store to sell his catch and other food products. He would like to use the loan to expand his fishing operation. He hopes that with his continued hard work he will one day be able educate all of his children to the university level.

loans.use: To expand his fishing operation

loans.name: Siko

texts.en:
Siko V. is currently in the business of selling various items like biscuits, toothpaste etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase pulses and tomatoes to sell.  Siko is 45 years old and is widowed. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta D. is from the village of P-9, Luinab, Iligan City. She is 49 years old. Violeta is single. To make a living, Violeta sells purified drinking water in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

location.town: P-9A, Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en: Tinkagirize Francis, the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi, is a 46-year-old married father of six children, all in secondary and primary schools. Francis, a hard-working and friendly man, has been operating both a bee-keeping and a farming business for 10 years.  Although he likes what he does, he is affected by the expensive materials used in bee-keeping as well as the limited market for the honey made from it. He is now requesting a loan to help buy a piece of land that he will use to increase his farming output. His goal is to spread his business ideas to other parts of the district since he has been helped by the National Agricultural Advisory Services (NAADS). He also hopes to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama wants to take out a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Fatama wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a shop selling fuel. Zhabida wants to take out a loan for a carpet weaving business. Hormela wants to take out a loan for her husband who works in photography. 

Fatama is the leader of Fatama Group. The four members of this group each want to take out a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan of 30,000 afghanis. They thank AFS and Kiva lenders that provide support all across the world.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old and happily married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Sandra sells foodstuffs like garri (roasted cassava), beans, rice and dried fish and has been in this business for 5 years. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bortul

texts.en:
Bortul I. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials including flour. Thirty-nine years old and widowed, she has two children, both of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel at the Malakia street.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials such as flour, etc

loans.name: Trần Thị's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Trần Thị (10114070013) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Huệ is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cổ Dương 2 (1).

Huệ is married and has two adult children. She works in a family business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,148,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Huệ is now requesting a new loan of 3,706,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Lê Thị Lý (10114070014) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2. Ngô Thị N. (10114070015) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3. Dương Thị H. (10114070012) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Huệ Trần Thị (10114070013) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cổ Dương 2 (1).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch rau quả để bán. Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2003, Huệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Huệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6,148,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,706,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Lê Thị Lý (10114070014) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Ngô Thị N. (10114070015) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3. Dương Thị H. (10114070012) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday, 35 years old and married with three children, sells spare motor parts to make a living. In this business for six years, he hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell

loans.name: Family Tree Group

texts.en:
Family Tree is a group of three borrowers led by Losene B. F., a 25-year-old single father of a two-year-old child. Losene and his child live in the Geebadu Quarter, a large Mandingo (a local tribe in Liberia) community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia. He is a high school graduate but could not attend university due to a lack of financial support.

For the past year, Losene has been selling raw rice which he buys from wholesalers and then retails in the Voinjama main market. He has been facing some financial problems over the last few months with business, but because rice is a staple in Liberia, buyers always patronize his enterprise due to the good relationship he fosters with his customers. He needs this loan to purchase more rice wholesale in order to improve business, and he dreams of giving his child a better education and eventually having a large store.

loans.use: To purchase more rice wholesale to improve business

loans.name: Vanesio's Group

texts.en:
B. Vanesio is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a nice person and loves what he does, in addition to wanting the best for others.

Vanesio is 30 years old and is a hardworking and determined man with a business he has had for two years selling produce in the town. Before this business, Vanesio was only a farmer but now he goes to the market himself to sell his produce. He also buys from other farmers when he has a deficit. He is good at handling his customers and this has helped him expand due to his many customers.

Vanesio needs a loan to help buy more produce for resale. He is grateful that the loans help him have a variety to sell. He hopes to have a happy and healthy family in future so that his children can be self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Osagie

texts.en:
Osagie is 38 years old and married with two children. He has been a farmer for the past 8 years and has been with LAPO Microfinance for over two years.

Osagie is requesting the loan of N30,000. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to plant and to cultivate his farmland

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en: Kayode O. is 32 years old and married with a child. He sells lubricants such as engine oil. He is a hardworking man who hopes to expand his business. Kayode is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more lubricants to sell. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lubricants to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old and married with four children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.  She is a farmer and has been in business for over 15 years. Victoria is requesting a loan of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seeds to plant and cultivate on her farmland. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 51-year-old widow with six children. She is a hardworking woman who sells rechargeable phone cards and also makes photocopies of documents for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount 50,000 NGN to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and a photocopier. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and a photocopier

loans.name: Eni

texts.en: Eni is 60 years old and married with 11 children. He offers computer and printing services to customers within his community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase a generator and printing materials. He sends a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and printing materials

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 51 years old and married with three children. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers, and is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is fifty-nine years old. He is married and has seven children who are all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso.

James is a trader. He trades in machetes (broad heavy knives used in agriculture) which he sells at the market square in his community. He procures his goods from Kumasi and sharpens them himself before selling. He also treks to other markets to sell.

James has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy machetes in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy machetes in bulk

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 43 years old and married with a child. She is a farmer. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings, to plant and cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings, to plant and cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Courage

texts.en: Courage owns a computer center where he renders computer services to his clients within his community. He is 23 years old and single without a child. He is also a part-time student in the university. He hopes for a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase a generator to enable him to meet the requirements of his clients when there is no electricity supply. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Hands Of Friendship Group

texts.en:
Hands of Friendship is a group of 5 borrowers led by Massa H., who is 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 9 and 14, their educational levels 4th and 8th grade. She is a high school graduate but could not attend university due to lack of financial support. Massa and her family live in the Geebadu Quarter, a large Mandingo (a local tribe in Liberia) community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa County in northern Liberia.

Massa’s business is selling used clothing. She buys used clothes wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama main market, in the capital of Lofa County in northern Liberia. She has been running this business for 5 years and hopes to expand to a bigger shop.

Massa has been facing some financial constraints over the years with her business; therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more wholesale used clothing to improve her business. She talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. The business is her only means of income. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more wholesale used clothing to improve business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a married 43-year-old businessman. He operates a transport business, transporting primary-school children to and from home. He has been in the business for a period of two years. He gets a profit of about 14,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

M. was introduced to KADET by a group member and has never borrowed elsewhere. He wants to use the loan to improve his car for better service and to build and stock a small retail shop (kiosk) for his wife. He hopes to buy a new van for school transport to increase carrying capacity to over 100 children, from the current 30 children. He also wishes to open a good business for his wife.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions for micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To improve his car for transport and build and stock a small retail shop (kiosk) for his spouse

loans.name: Omosefe

texts.en: Omosefe is 63 years old. She is married with 9 children. She is a farmer. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more crop seedlings, to plant and cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crop seedlings, to plant and cultivate her farmland

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 34 years old, is married to Loise Mwikali, and is the father of two children: Emmanuel, 10 years old, and Jason, 3 years old. William comes from a humble background where his parents couldn't pay for his education, but his future dream is that his children are able to get a good education. William was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. He is applying for his second loan. He wants to purchase spare parts for his business (e.g. a compressor, accessories) so as to increase his number of clients. William is intending to extend his workshop and get more working space for his business with the extra profits. His hopes and dreams are to get a bigger workshop and to employ three more staff. He is outgoing, a people person, patient with people and very hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his electronics repair shop

loans.name: Ireen Nekesa

texts.en:
Ireen Nekesa O. has run a school called the Springs of Life School for two years. She employs four teachers and one cook. Her primary challenges are that many parents do not understand the value of an education and others cannot afford the fees. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to build another classroom. 

Ireen is married with four children, ranging from a five-year-old boy to an eighteen-year-old girl. She describes herself as hardworking and honest, and supplements her income by baking birthday and wedding cakes. Ireen's goals for the school are to extend its offering to class eight, grow to five hundred pupils, and be known as one of the best schools in Kenya.

loans.use: To build another classroom

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 25 years old and married with a child. He lives in Edo State, Nigeria, and has been a farmer for over four years. Lawrence is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings to plant and cultivate on his farmland. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is 27 years old, and is married with two children who are both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the busy commercial/farming community of Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region.

Kofi runs a roadside grocery store in his community. He sells all kinds of provisions, which he procures from Kumasi and sometimes from distribution vans. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk for his store

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de viande de bœufs, il exerce son commerce dans l’enceinte de l’abattoir du grand marché de Lomé. Les tenanciers de restaurant viennent s’approvisionner chez lui. Actuellement la demande de ses clients est élevée mais les balances qu’il utilise pour peser la marchandise sont usées, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une balance électrique et deux (02) balances ordinaires.
Il est marié et père de 05 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman has income-generating work selling beef. He operates in the slaughterhouse enclosure at the grand market of Lomé. Restaurant owners come to him to stock up. Currently, customer demand is high. But the scales he uses to weigh the merchandise are worn. He’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy an electronic scale and two ordinary scales. He is married and the father of five children. With the revenues from this business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balances

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 39 years old and married with four children. She has been a farmer for six years, and is requesting a loan of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings to plant and cultivate on her farmland. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings

loans.name: Elizabeth Jepkorir

texts.en:
Elizabeth Jepkorir is 40 years old. She is married to Peter, a businessman, and is blessed with three children.

Elizabeth was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by Roseline Kiptoo. With the loan Elizabeth is requesting from KADET, she plans to add stock, including trousers, shorts and shoes, to her clothing business. Her dreams are to grow her clothing business and buy a plot of land in Iten Town to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 27 years old, is married to Patrick, and is blessed with two sons and one daughter.

Tabitha was introduced to KADET through an existing member. She is planning to expand and increase the stock for her greengrocery business. This will also enable her to increase her number of clients because her greengrocery targets customers who buy in both retail and wholesale.

Tabitha intends to purchase a dairy cow with the extra profit she earns. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and to be able to purchase farm produce directly from farmers so that she cannot be exploited and will be able to make more profit.

Tabitha describes herself as an ambitious lady, a visionary and a hardworking lady.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase the stock in her greengrocery business

loans.name: Philo

texts.en:
A. Philo is 39 years old and married with six children. She has been a farmer for the past ten years.

Philo hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, is married to Serah, and has one son and two daughters. Peter is an orphan and he helped in educating his siblings so that they are now self-reliant. He can be described as a hardworking man and delivers clients’ work on time.

Peter came to know about KADET through market outreach in Juja town. He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET.

Peter does carpentry work - he makes chairs, beds etc. He is planning to expand his business through the purchase of timber and fabric to satisfy his clients’ needs.

Peter intends to buy his own wood processing tools since he has to outsource. His future hopes and dreams are to open a big timber workshop and to hire many young people whom he can train in carpentry work.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase timber and fabric for his carpentry business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria and she has been farming for the past three years.

Helen hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: God Blessing Group

texts.en:
God Blessing Group is a group of two borrowers led by Nancy B. G..

Nancy is 52 years old and is married with two children aged 29 and 31, with educational levels of 12th grade and university graduate. She also cares for three orphans that were found during the Liberian crisis. Nancy is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in the Sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Nancy’s business is selling children’s clothing. She buys children’s clothes wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama main market. She has been running this business for five years and is hoping to expand to a bigger shop. She talks to her customers with a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from her.

Nancy and her family depend on her business for their daily needs because her husband is retired. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more used clothing wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and of building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing wholesale

loans.name: Mohamed Boi

texts.en:
Mohamed is 36 years old and is married with three kids. He is engaged in the rental of DVDs and also operates a phone centre.

For the past seven years, Mohamed has been selling and renting DVDs.  Prior to his current location, Mohamed sold and rented DVDs from his backpack, traveling to his customers. He was constantly moving around to meet his customers until he rented a shop with money he saved over the years. He is very hardworking and works from 8:00 am to 11:00 p.m. daily. His wife usually assists him in the shop.

Mohamed is seeking a loan to buy more DVDs to stock his shop and to buy more call cards to better operate his phone centre. He hopes that the profits from the loan will be used to pay for his children’s schooling.  This is Mohamed’s first loan.

loans.use: To purchase call cards and DVDs

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a widow with three children aged 14, 7, and 4 years. Apart from her children Zainab has one dependent.

Zainab rents a store at a strategic location in the eastern part of Freetown where ships berth. She sells rice and pillet (pig feed) and has built up her business for about eight years.

As Zainab is the one fending for the family, she is hoping to use the loan to buy more rice and pillet. She intends to use part of the proceeds to run the home and to rent a much bigger shop space.

loans.use: To buy more rice and pillet

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old and is married with two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past fourteen years.

Margaret is requesting the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a fashion designer and she is also a caterer. She is 38 years old and single without a child. She has been in this business since 2002.

Rose hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Osas

texts.en:
Osas is 37 years old and married with a child. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the past five years.

Osas is requesting the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Mawuesso

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits pharmaceutiques, cela lui permet de d’aider son époux dans les charges du foyer. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé. Une partie de son stock étant épuisée, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 40 seringues, 30 perfuseurs, 100 élastiques.
texts.en:
This is a married woman who is the mother of one child. She has a business selling pharmaceutical products. This enables her to help her husband with expenses at home. She stocks up in Lomé. A portion of her stock being exhausted, she’s requesting a WAGES loan for buying 40 syringes, 30 perfusers, and 100 elastic bands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Bengadee Group

texts.en:
Bengadee Group is a group of two borrowers led by Fatu K..

Fatu is 42 years old and is married with two children aged 15 and 23 years old, with educational levels of 5th grade and 12th grade. She also cares for four orphans. Fatu is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in the Sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa County, northern Liberia.

Fatu’s business is selling clothing. She buys clothes wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama main market. She has been running this business for five years and hopes to expand to a bigger shop. She talks to her customers with a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from her.

Fatu and her family depend on her business for their daily needs. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more clothing wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
The business activity from which Gladys makes a living is the sale of provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She started this business six years ago.

Gladys is 41 years old and married with three children. She hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 56 years old and happily married with four children.

Christiana is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia A. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, onions, etc., and is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Cicilia is 35 years old and is married to an accountant. She has one child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Adovi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a pour activité la vente d’appareils électroniques, il fait aussi la location de matériel de sonorisation. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, pour pouvoir tous les satisfaire et convenablement il doit augmenter son stock de marchandises, pour cette raison il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 40 hauts parleurs et 20 écrans de 14 pouces.
Il est marié et est père de 3 enfants, sa femme est une revendeuse. Avec ce qu’il gagne de son commerce, il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This man's business is the sale of electronic devices. He also installs sound equipment. His clientele grows from day to day. To be able to satisfy them all properly he must grow his stock of merchandise. For this reason he requests a loan from WAGES to increase his stock with 40 tall speakers and 20 14-inch screens. He is married and is the father of 3 children. His wife is a dealer. With what he earns from his business he provides for the family expenses.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tall speakers and 14-inch screens for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian A. makes a living selling grains in a local market, and has applied for this loan to buy more millet to sell to her customers. She is 30 years old, married to a soldier and the mother of five school-aged children. She hopes to build a shop with the extra income she earns from this loan. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more millet to sell

loans.name: Johnbull

texts.en: Johnbull is 40 years old, married and has six children. For the last seven years, he has made a living as a farmer. He is applying for this loan to buy more seedlings to plant and raise on his farm. He extends his thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings to plant and raise on his farm

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en: Nosa is 30 years old and single. For the last seven years, he has made a living as a farmer. He has applied for this loan to buy more seedlings to plant and raise on his farm.  Nosa extends his thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings to plant and raise on his farm

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard A. leads a loan group in the town of Bushenyi. He is 46 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He is also raising two orphans. 

Richard is a businessman who makes a living running a bakery that he inherited from his father and has successfully run for more than 10 years. He sells his goods to people in suburbs, secondary schools, a local college and in other shops. His main challenge is securing the ingredients he needs to bake, such as flour and oil. 

Richard has a motorcycle that makes it easy for him to distribute bread, doughnuts, cookies, pancakes, kebabs and chapattis. His dream is to open a store in a suburban town and buy a van so that he can expand his customer base and make enough money to send his children to college. He has applied for this loan to buy more raw materials for baking such as firewood, flour and cooking oil. Without loans like this, his business would not be nearly as successful as it is.  He is determined to earn a larger income and make sure that his family lives well.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for a bakery.

loans.name: Fataou

texts.fr: Pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins,  ce monsieur s’est lancé dans la vente de produits pharmaceutiques. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et il s’approvisionne au Ghana, cela lui permet de  vendre à un prix  abordable et de cette façon de vendre plus. Faisant face à une réduction de son stock, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de QUINIMAX, 3 cartons de sérum, 3 cartons de perfuseurs.
texts.en:
To be able to provide for his own needs, this man launched himself in the sale of pharmaceutical products. This business succeeds well for him. He supplies himself in Ghana, which allows him to sell at a reasonable price and in this manner to sell more. Facing a reduction of his stock, he requests a loan to buy 2 boxes of QUINIMAX (an anti-malarial drug), 3 boxes of serum, and 3 boxes of intravenous drip lines.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products for resale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: For years, Patience has made a living selling fresh fish. She is 50 years old, married and has nine children. She has applied for this loan to buy more fresh fish to sell. Patience extends her sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 42 years old and married with seven children, all still in school. She helps take care of two orphans. She is a friendly, determined and hardworking lady who has had a business selling firewood in Buramba for eight years. Before this business, Harriet was selling matooke (steamed green plantain). She changed because of limited competition in this current business. 

She sells mostly to schools and homes. She had many customers because of her friendly nature and because the use of loans helps her to have stock all the time. She hopes to open up another store in the main town so that she could make more sales. Harriet needs a loan to help buy more firewood for resale.

loans.use: Buying more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 36 years old and married with three children. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
The Promise Group is a group of three borrowers led by Johnson A.. He is 50 years old and married with six children, who are aged 11-34 years old and whose educational levels range from 5th grade to university senior.  He is a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. Johnson and his family live in the V.M.H.S. community in downtown Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Johnson's business is pit sawing. He saws logs, cuts them into timber and sells them in the Voinjama main market. He has been running this business for nine years and hopes to improve it by establishing a wood workshop. With hard work and commitment, he believes he can reach that goal.

John has been facing some financial difficulties with his business but because he sells good timber to customers, they are always encouraged to continue buying from him, which makes his business go forward. He needs this loan in order to purchase sawing materials like gasoline, engine oil, etc., to improve business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sawing materials like gasoline, engine oil, etc., to improve business

loans.name: Igiebor

texts.en: Igiebor A. is married with seven children. He is 57 years old. He has been in the farming business for the past 15 years. He is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more seedlings to plant. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky O. is married with five children. He is a 39-year-old farmer. He has been in the farming business for the past six years. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more seedlings to plant. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 23 years old and married with four children. She sells shoes and clothes to make a living.

Sales during this season are very high and she hopes to meet the requirements of her customers during this high season. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell. She really appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 31-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Nimer owns a grocery store in which he sells candies, raw materials, canned food, cheese, soft drinks and juices, bread, cleaning home products, etc. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store to increase his stock. This is the first time that Nimer has requested a loan.

Nimer is special in his work because he sells a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Nimer knows how to suit his clients’ demands – for example, if a client wants something and Nimer doesn’t have it, he does his best to find it. When Nimer first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing this business because he took over his father’s store; his father had owned the store since 1975.

In the future, Nimer plans on expanding his business by opening another grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Kivork

texts.en:
Kivork is a 46-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Kivork works with diamonds. He actually installs diamonds on watches, rings, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc. He has done this work since 2000. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do maintenance work on his machine, the one he uses for the diamonds. This is the first time that Kivork has requested a loan.

Kivork is special in his work because he does very precise and clean work. His clients are jewelry shops. When Kivork first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening another store.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his diamond machine

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 44-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. Jean has owned a shoe factory since 2004. He produces shoes. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase rubber material for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his productivity. The difference between his work and others work is that he has a low income.  When Jean first started his business, he had faced some financial problems. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and he had experience in trading. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase rubber material for his work.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells fufu. Fufu is a local food made from fermented cassava and it is usually eaten with a local soup in Nigeria. Regina lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 21-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Wissam owns a grocery store. He sells candies, raw materials, canned food, cheese, soft drinks and juices, bread, cleaning home products etc.  His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. He has always repaid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise. Wissam is special in his work because he owns a big variety of products. When Wissam first started his business, he passed through some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he took over his father's store. His father has owned the store since 1972. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 52 years old and married with four children. She sells cooking oil at retail to her customers. This season is a high season for the sale of her cooking oil and she hopes to meet the requirement of her customers. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 40 years old and married with six children. She sells provisions and drinks very close to her house. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. She is a food vendor.

Lydia runs a chop (food) bar in her community. She buys foodstuffs such as cassava, plantains, etc. from nearby towns. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Lydia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food items to prepare and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase horses to help transport merchandise

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia G. is 50 years old and married to Vicente G. who is presently managing the boarding house that they own. The couple is blessed with 2 children who have already graduated from college. The older, 28 years old, is a teacher while the younger is 26 years old and works with the Coastguard. The family lives in the village of Sitio Serena, Brgy Enclaro, Binalbagan Negros Occidental.

It was always Amalia's dream to be able to send her children to school so they would have their own jobs, and to help her husband pay for their household expenses -- and she has done all this with the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

Amalia joined NWTF-PD in January 1995 and used the first cycle loan to start a general or "sari-sari" store. Since it was in a good location, she was able to earn a good income, and she used her subsequent loans to continue improving the operations of her general store. Later, they started taking in boarders, and her husband took care of managing the boarding house. She was able to earn a net monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her businesses.

With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, plus her own efforts and the support of her family, she was able to send her 2 children to school until they finished their college education, a fulfillment of one of her most cherished dreams. She has also acquired a few productive assets such as a refrigerator for her general store, and she had electricity and water pumps installed in her boarding house.

Now Amalia is helping some members of her extended family by supporting the education of her nephew, paying tuition and providing him with an allowance so that he will have some spending money while in school.

In her previous loan, Amalia borrowed Php 19,500 which she used as additional working capital, using part of the income to support her nephew's education. Now she is borrowing for her 14th loan the amount of PHP 23,000, again as additional capital for her general store. She intends to use the income to continue supporting not only her immediate family but she hopes to also improve the lives of other relatives so that they too will achieve their potential just like her own children. This is her way of practicing being "Dungganon" (honorable)

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but of thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her General Store

loans.name: Rosa De La Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Nicolasa is the group coordinator of her group Rosa de la Fe (Rose of the Faith) and her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) more generally. Her group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her husband and four children.

Nicolasa is excited to take her first loan with Esperanza and to start doing better business. She plans to use this loan to purchase purses and purse accessories to sell to her neighbors. She has identified a market for this product and she believes she will turn a profit. With these profits she plans to purchase some school supplies for her children and additionally to build up savings. Also, she would like to enroll in literacy classes with the goal of being able to read and write which will allow her to continue to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purses and fashion accesories

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal N. is 42 years old and single but she takes care of 5 dependents. Chantal lives in the Nyarugenge district in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. Chantal is a true entrepreneur. She has owned a public secretariat since 2000. Chantal employs 4 people in her business, which is open from 8AM to 6PM every day.

Chantal is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more machines and equipment to add to her capacity for work and better serve her customers.

Through accessing this new loan, Chantal hopes to get more profit than before and it is with that profit that Chantal expects to be economically independent.

loans.use: machines and some other equipment

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Concepción M. cuando se casó, aprendió de su esposo el tejer alfombras, negocio con el cual sacaron adelante  a sus 4 hijos, ella tiene su pequeño taller en casa y cuando tienen suficientes productos su esposo los vende en la ciudad de La Paz, ahora necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar lana, hilacha e hilo, materia prima con los cuales confeccionan las alfombras, ella trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 7 años aproximadamente y le gusta sobre todo la atención que brindan en el consultorio.
Las demás integrantes del grupo 25 de Julio que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, también tienen sus negocios como la costura de polleras (faldas), el tejido de  prendas de vestir, atención de librería, venta de juguetes y ropa. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar  materia prima  y mercadería.
texts.en:
When Concepción M. got married she learned how to weave rugs from her husband. This business enabled her four children to get ahead. She has a small shop in her house. When she has enough products her husband sells them in the city of La Paz. She now needs a new loan to buy wool, thread, and yarn. These are the raw materials she uses to make the rugs. She has worked with Pro Mujer for approximately seven years. Above all, she likes the consultation services that they offer. The other members of the 25 de Julio group, which belongs to the German Busch community center, also have businesses like making “polleras” (skirts), weaving articles of clothing, working in a bookstore, and selling toys and clothes. They need the loan to buy raw material and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal U. is 30 years old; single, with one child who is six years old. Chantal lives in Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has owned a popular and attractive hair salon since 2007.

In her salon, Chantal employs three people from her community. Chantal is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through buying salon equipment and materials.

loans.use: More equipment

loans.name: Laurant

texts.en:
Laurant N. is 49 years old, married with 3 children. Laurant lives at Gasabo district, Sector of Gatsata, where he has been renting lodges since 2008 as his photo indicates. The place of his business is open 24 hours every day. 

Laurant is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of renewing the rooms in order to attract many customers. By renewing, Laurant hopes to get more profit, which will help him to expand his business through building more rooms for rental.

loans.use: build more room for rental

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: H. Séraphine est née en 1979 et vit depuis sept ans à Cadjèhoun un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HAGNONNOU Bienvenu, Séraphine est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Séraphine n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. C’est pourquoi, pour contribuer aux charges de la famille et satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens, Séraphine vend des fruits (bananes, ananas, etc.), et des divers (farine de manioc, galettes d’arachide, etc.) à son domicile au quartier Cadjèhoun. Séraphine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché Dogbo au Bénin. Séraphine a déjà six ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a eu déjà trois crédits et a bien remboursé. Pour mieux satisfaire la demande des clients et réaliser plus d’économies, Séraphine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Séraphine envisage plus tard acheter et construire sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
Séraphine H. was born in 1979 and has lived for seven years in Cadjèhoun, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Bienvenu Hagnonnou, Séraphine is the mother of two children who all attend school. The couple jointy support their family's needs. Séraphine did not have the opportunity to attend school. And so, to help contribute to family income and to satisfy their daily needs, Séraphine sells fruits (bananas, pineapples, etc.) and diverse food products ( manioc flour, peanut-based cookies etc.) from her home. Séraphine buys her provisions in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin and at the Dogbo market, also in Benin. Séraphine already has six years of experience. She is a former client of ALID from whom she recieved and repayed 3 loans. To better satisfy her customer demand and to see greater savings, Séraphine is asking for a fourth loan. One day she hopes to purchase and construct her own business site.
