Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits (bananas, plantains, oranges, pineapples) and other diverse products (manioc flour, sugar packets, peanut-based cookies)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is 43 years of age, married with five children. She lives in Gasabo district, outside the capital city of Kigali in Rwanda. Here, she operates a shoe sales business.  Esther has been successfully selling shoes since 2006. She employs two persons from her community and her shop is open every day from 7AM to 6PM.

Esther is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing a greater variety of shoes to reach a wider base of customers and serve her existing customers even better.

loans.use: More shoes types and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: more goods to add to the shop

loans.name: Motuya Plus Group

texts.fr:
Thoms K. est dirigeant de son groupe dont le nom est « Motuya Plus » qui signifie « Value Plus » en anglais, constitué de 21 membres unis solidairement pour développer leurs affaires à travers des prêts.
Thoms est gérant de sa propre cabine téléphonique depuis 2005. Il a acquit une expérience en gestion et en marketing. Il a déjà reçu 3 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a remboursés correctement. Il compte avec le prochain prêt renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant des cartes prépayées qui sont bien vendues dans son quartier. Thoms est célibataire âgé de 28 ans.
texts.en:
Thoms K. is the leader of his group named “Motuya Plus”, which means “Value Plus” in English. It is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to develop their businesses through loans. Thoms has been the manager of his own phone booth since 2005. He has acquired management and marketing experience. Thoms has already received a loan three times from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to bolster his stock of merchandise by buying prepaid cards, which sell well in his district. Thoms is an unmarried man who is 28 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid cards for resale in order to boost his capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine U. is 33 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Nyarugenge district outside of Kigali, where she owns her restaurant and drinking establishment – recently opened, just last year. Martine employs four persons from her community in her popular gathering spot, which is open every day from 8AM to 10 PM.

Martine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to provide needed working capital reserves for her business, which will allow her to purchase sufficient inventory and supplies, which will help her to have a more successful enterprise.

loans.use: Working Capital and Inventory/Foodstuffs

loans.name: Dynamique Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Dynamique Plus «  est un groupe  composé de 24 emprunteurs en caution solidaire dont Monique est dirigeante. Ces membres sont solidairement unis pour recevoir des microcrédits en vue de renforcer leurs activités. 
Monique T. 43 ans, gère son propre restaurant depuis 2005. Elle travaille durement et avec l’appui financier de l’IMF HOPE RDC, Monique est déterminée à moderniser son restaurant  en achetant du matériel électrique en vue de préparer rapidement et de servir plus de clients. Elle compte avec le prochain crédit acheter deux cartons des poissons et des poulets pour renforcer le stock de nourriture au restaurant. Monique est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants âgés de 13 à 16 ans. Tous deux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
“Dynamique Plus” is a group composed of 24 borrowers guaranteeing one another jointly, which includes the leader, Monique. These members are united in solidarity for receiving micro-loans with the aim of bolstering their businesses. Monique T., aged 43, has been managing her own restaurant since 2005. She works hard, and with financial support from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC, she is determined to modernize her restaurant by buying electric equipment with the aim of making food quickly and serving more customers. She intends to use the next loan to buy two boxes of fish and some chicken to bolster her stock of food at the restaurant. Monique is divorced and the mother of two children, who are 13 and 16 years old. Both of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two boxes of fish and chlden to bolster her restaurant inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie N. is 43 years old, married with four children aged 10 through 19, and she takes care of one dependent who is 21 years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district near Kigali. She is a proven entrepreneur! Since 2003, Eugenie has owned a small fruit shop where she employs two people from her community. Her shop is open every day from 7AM to 5PM.

Eugenie is requesting her first loan from vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through buying more volume and varieties of fruit and produce for sale.

loans.use: Fruit and Produce

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice G. is 37 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Kicukiro district in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. Alice owns a small shoe shop, which she has been operating successfully since 2006. She buys many types of the same shoes to allow for better pricing which she passes on to her customers. Her business is open every day from 8AM to 6PM.

Alice is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to provide needed working capital reserves for inventory and general operating expenses.

loans.use: Shoes and working capital

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.en:
Jean d’Amour K. is 41 years old, married with 8 children aged between 6 and 21 years old. Jean lives at Rubavu district in the city of Gisenyi. He has been an entrepreneur selling clothes for the past 8 years. He employs one person in his business - a helper. His shop is open from 9AM to 6PM every day.

Jean is now requesting his second loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing a greater variety of clothing for sale. By receiving and using this loan prudently, with the (hoped for) profit from his business expansion, he will be able to pay school fees and provide more food for his children

loans.use: a variety of clothes

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: A. Sylvie est née le 26-09-1973 et vit depuis dix huit ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KPONDEHOU Cosme, un affairiste, Sylvie est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Sylvie et Cosme supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Après avoir arrêté les études au secondaire, Sylvie s’est mise depuis seize ans dans la vente de maïs, du haricot et de la farine de manioc. En effet, Sylvie s’approvisionne aux marchés de Houègbo et de Glazoué, marchés des produits vivriers au Bénin. Sylvie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a obtenu antérieurement trois crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour accroître et diversifier son activité, Sylvie sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Sylvie was born on September, 26, 1973. For 18 years, she has been living in the Cadjèhoun district in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Married to KPONDEHOU Cosme, a wheeler-dealer, she is the mother of two children who are in school. Sylvie and Cosme together support the family. After having halted her studies in secondary school, Sylvie started selling corn, beans, and cassava flour sixteen years ago. Basically, she stocks up at the marketplace of Houègbo and Glazoué, which sells staple foods in Benin. She is a former ALIDé client who obtained three loans before, which she repaid to ALIDé. To grow and diversify her business, Sylvie is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to cope better with customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, beans, and cassava flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a variety of goods for resale

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre, dos hermanas y su hijo de 25 años, quien trabaja y la apoya. Hace un año alquiló un local, juntamente con su hijo, al costado de su casa, donde implementó un negocio de venta de accesorios y útiles de oficina, y cabinas para el servicio de Internet. Llerme se decidió por este rubro porque en la zona donde vive hay varias oficinas legales y contables y las personas que trabajan allí son sus principales clientes. Pero ésta no es la única actividad a la que se dedica Llerme, ya que también trabaja en una heladería atendiendo al público desde hace 11 años. 

Lo que le gusta de sus labores es que se encuentra cerca de su casa, además de dar una buena atención a los clientes y mantener amenas conversaciones con ellos. Por otro lado, considera que le es muy rentable porque el primero es un negocio propio que le genera ingresos diarios, y en la heladería obtiene un pago mensual y seguro. Para un futuro, Llerme quisiera tener una tienda de ropa. 

Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y se siente a gusto en su banco comunal porque no tienen problemas, trabajan bien y son responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más útiles de oficina para incrementar el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Llerme, age 50, is a single mother. She lives with her mother, two sisters, and her 25 year old son who works and supports her. For a year, together with her son, she has rented a space next to her home where she has begun a business selling office supplies and operating an internet café. Llerme decided to go into this business because in the area where she lives there are several law and accounting offices, and the people who work there are her principal customers. This is not her only work, however. She also works in an ice cream parlor, serving the public for 11 years.

What she likes about her work is that it is located near her house. In addition, she likes giving good service to her customers and having pleasant conversations with them. Furthermore, she considers her activities profitable because the first is her own business that provides her with daily income, and in the ice cream parlor she obtains secure pay on a monthly basis. In the future, Llerme hopes to have a clothing shop.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is pleased with her communal bank because they don’t have problems. They work well and are responsible with their payments. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy more office supplies in order to increase the stock of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Ebenezer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Gloria is the coordinator of her group Ebenezer and her story is representative of both the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated from the DR to Haiti) more generally. Her group is based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her 2 children and husband.

Gloria has proven herself to be an exemplary associate of Esperanza and this will be her fourth loan with Esperanza. With this new loan she plans to continue investing in her business of selling purses, shoes and accessories by buying more merchandise, such as 100 headbands to sell. With the profits she hopes to generate, she plans to invest in her own home as well as in books for her children. Her long-term dream is to establish her business well enough to have extra time to work with children and to start a foundation to help children with few resources live a better life. She thanks you for your support of her progress toward this noble goal!

loans.use: Shoes, purses and accessories

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: A. Cécile est née en 1973 et réside depuis dix ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cécile s’est mariée à YEHO Antonin, un conducteur de taxi- moto. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cécile est une analphabète et s’est très tôt mise dans la vente de grandes cuillères de tous genres. En effet, Cécile vend de façon ambulante depuis trente ans des cuillères à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile achète ces articles à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Cécile a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pour agrandir son commerce et réaliser plus d’économies, Cécile s’est rapprochée encore une fois de ALIDé pour obtenir un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
A. Cécile is born in 1973 and has been living in the Cadjehoun neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for ten years. She is married to YEHO Antonin, a moto-taxi driver. The couple has two children, all in school and at their expense. Cécile is an illiterate and she started very early in the sale of various types of large spoons. Infact, Cécile has been selling the spoons from door to door in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, for thirty years. Cécile buys these items at Abomey, the historic town of Benin. Cecile already obtained three loans from ALIDé that she repaid correctly. To grow her trade and make more savings, Cecile once again approached ALIDé to obtain a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking utensils( laddle, various types of spoons, forks, etc)

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria, de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una chacra que queda a dos días de viaje en bote por río, donde ha sembrado 3 hectáreas de fríjoles, 5 de papayas y 1 de plátanos. Silveria está muy contenta porque en el caso de las papayas, producen todos los días, mientras que el fríjol y los plátanos son por temporada, obteniendo buenas ganancias por sus frutas.

Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse activa y le es rentable, además cada vez que va a su chacra aprovecha para llevar ropa de segundo uso que compra en la ciudad, la cual vende a sus vecinos de cultivo o la intercambia por gallinas o pescados salados, los mismos que vende en cuanto regresa a su casa. 

Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son personas cumplidas y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita contratará personal para ampliar y preparar su chacra (5 cuadras), donde sembrara maíz y yuca.
texts.en:
Silverio, 43, is a single mother. She lives with her two children in her own house. She has been farming for three years. She has a small farm, which she gets to by a two day trip by boat on the river. This is where she plants three hectares of beans, five of papaya, and one of bananas. Silveria is very happy because the papayas produce every day while the beans and bananas are seasonal. She gets good income from her fruits. What she likes most about her work is staying active, and it is profitable for her. Every time she goes to the farm she takes the opportunity to take second hand clothing with her. She buys it in the city and sells it to her farming neighbors. Sometimes she exchanges it for chickens or salted fish, which she sells when she returns home. This is her fourth loan with MFP. What she likes about her communal bank is that all of the people are accomplished and hard-working. With the money she is now asking for she will hire people to expand and prepare her farm (five blocks) where she plants corn and yucca.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion and preparation of her fields

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es: Johana Patricia G. tiene 36 años, hace más de 12 años que inicio este negocio. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya siempre se ha preocupado por pagar puntualmente sus deudas. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, en cual le ha servido de apoyo para sacar adelante a su familia. En futuro le gustaría obtener su propia tienda en la que ofrezca muchos productos variados para satisfacer la amplia demanda de clientes que tiene. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, cremas y colonias.
texts.en:
Johana Patricia G. is 36. It has been over 12 years since she started this business. She has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has always made sure that she pays her debts punctually. She sells general merchandise. She has been in this humble business for over 11 years. It has served as a support to get ahead with her family. In the future she would like to have her own store where she could offer a lot of various products to satisfy her customers’ large demand. The loan she is asking for is to buy shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, creams, and colognes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de cinq femmes (trois mariées et deux célibataires) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des foyers monogames  à Ouayerma, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Dans le but de d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de bois de chauffe,  de fruits et  légumes, de bazins et de pagnes wax. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 colis de pagnes wax, 10  chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe,  40 paniers de fruits et 2 pièces de bazins. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville auprès des grossistes. Les marchandises sont revendues au marché de Médine, dans les différents quartiers ou de façon ambulante, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée dans l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent devenir des grossistes et entreprendre des voyages entre le Mali et les pays frontaliers.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of five women (three are married and two are single) with an average age of 34 years and 3 children and living in private homes in Ouayerma, a district in the village of Sikasso, an economic hub in Mali.

In order to increase their sales, they have decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner), this being the group's sixth loan. All of their past loans have been properly repaid.

They each carry out different businesses, such as firewood sales, sales of fruits and vegetables, and sales of fabrics.

With this new loan they plan on purchasing 20 rolls of printed fabrics, 10 wheelbarrows of firewood, 40 baskets of frutis and 2 measures of taffeta fabric.

They purchase their products from wholesalers in the large market in the village of Sikasso. The merchandise is later resold in the markets in Medine, and in various districts, to a clientele made up of both men and women, most of whom pay in cash.

Their monthlyh forecasted earnings are of 15000FCFA, part of which will be put towards the education and health care of their children, and another part will be used to repay the loan.

The women of the Danaya group are ambitious and plan on becoming wholesalers and plan on making trips from Mali to other neighboring countries.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora MARIA L. B., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN L.  y presenta estudios hasta 2do de Primaria y tiene 3 hijos todos menores y dependen económicamente de ella. MARIA se dedica a sembrar zanahoria, lechuga, veterraga, culantro, etc (verduras y vegetales) en la chacra que tiene en el caserío de caratas. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró abono y semillas para sembrar en su chacra.
Con este crédito de 300  nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono y semillas. La socia sueña con tener una buena cosecha y así obtener para la crianza de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria L. B. is 38 years old. She lives in the Trujillo district of the province of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad, Peru. This associate is part of the “San L.” communal bank and has completed studies up to the 2nd grade of primary school. She has 3 minor children who are her economic dependants. Maria works planting carrots, lettuce, beets, cilantro, etc. (vegetables and herbs) in the field that she has in the settlement of Caratas. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought fertilizer and seeds to plant in her field. With this loan for 300 PEN she will buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds. This associate dreams of having a good harvest in order to earn enough for raising her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprará sacos de abono y semillas .

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Benkadi (une veuve, deux célibataires et 5 mariées),  ont en moyenne 32 ans, 2 enfants et  vivent dans des ménages monogames  dans le quartier Bozo à Diamarabougou  de Markala relevant de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe se sont connus par des relations de parenté de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes bozos qui existe  depuis  plus de 10 ans.
Après quatre 4 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés sans aucune difficulté, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à son 5ème prêt de groupe.
 Elles comptent utiliser leur prêt pour acheter, 462kg de poissons, 15 sachets de glace et 4 cartons de poissons fumés. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés à Macina (Mignon et Diado), en poissons frais sur place à Markala au bord du fleuve Niger au niveau du pont, dans les zones de pêche de Markala et à Niono (Dora), en glace à Seribala et Dougabougou. Les poissons sont vendus à Bamako, Ségou (marché du château) et sur place à Markala sous toutes les formes, frais, frits, fumés et séchés, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elles disposent de  fours et séchoirs traditionnels spécialement conçus dans un coin de leurs cours pour la fumage et le séchage des poissons.  
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 60 500 FCFA par mois qui servira d’épargne en vue de l’achat de congélateur, à la contribution d’achat de matériels de pêche pour leurs maris, aux frais scolaires des enfants et aux petites dépenses familiales notamment (savon, habillements).
Elles ont pour ambition de posséder  chacune un congélateur afin de diminuer les charges.
texts.en:
The eight members of Benkadi Group (one widowed, two single and five married women), on average, are 32 years old and have two children. They live in monogamous families in the neighborhood of Bozo in the city of Diamarabougou de Markala, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are neighbors or family members to each other and are members of the same traditional association of women from Bozo, which has existed for over ten years. The women of Benkadi Group have repaid without difficulty their previous four group loans on schedule and are now applying for their fifth group loan.

They will use their loan to buy 462 kg of fish, 15 bags of ice and 4 boxes of smoked fish. They get their supply of smoked fish in Macina (Mignon and Diado), of fresh fish on location in Markala on the banks of the River Niger, near the bridge, in the fishery zones of Markala and in Niono (Dora), and of ice in Seribala and Dougabougou. The fish, whether fresh, fried, smoked or dried, will be sold in Bamako, at the Castle Market in Ségou and on location in Markala, for cash and seldom on credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They have at their disposal in their backyards traditional specialized ovens and dryers to smoke and dry their fish.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 60,500 CFA francs (US$138). They will save this money to buy freezers, to help their husbands to buy fishery material, to pay their children’s school fees and the small household expenses, in particular soap and clothing. Their ambition is to own, each of them, a freezer to bring down their expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso.

Joana is a trader. She trades in cosmetics. She sells on a table top at the local market square and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Joana sometimes hawks to sell in her community. She buys her goods such as pomade, powder, etc. from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: N. Célestine est née en 1960 et vit au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trente ans. Célestine s’est mariée à EZIN Didier, un tailleur. Célestine et Didier vivent ensemble et ont trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Célestine n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. C’est pourquoi, pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Célestine vend depuis dix huit ans déjà, des œufs, du maïs et du riz à la devanture de sa maison à Cadjèhoun.  Célestine achète ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Célestine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Célestine souhaite agrandir davantage son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Célestine sollicite à nouveau un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Célestine N. was born in 1960 and has lived in the Cadjèhoun à Cotonou neighborhood, economical capital of Benin, for thirty years. Célestine is married to Didier Ezin, a tailor. Célestine and Didier live together and have three children in their charge who all attend school. Célestine did not have the luck to go to school. This is the reason why Célestine has sold eggs, corn and rice from the store-window of her house in Cadjèhoun for 18 years; to provide for her needs and those of her children. Célestine buys these products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Célestine is a former customer of ALIDé that already has obtained three loans, which she repaid well to ALIDé. Célestine wishes to grow her business and better satisfy her clientele. This is the reason Célestine requests a fourth credit with ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and sacks of corn and rice for resale

loans.name: Esengo Plus Group

texts.fr:
Hortense N. 53 ans, est vendeuse de la boisson et des beignets devant sa maison. Elle est présidente de son groupe dénommé « Esengo Plus » qui signifie « Joy Plus » en anglais, composé de 26 micro-entrepreneurs unis solidairement pour contracter des prêts à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Hortense est déterminée à réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons à livrer à ses clients dans son quartier et les parties environnantes. Son activité évolue bien grâce aux 4 crédits qu’elle a déjà reçus de l’IMF HOPE RDC. Le prochain prêt lui permettra de diversifier son affaire en achetant 3 paniers des poissons frais qui constitue un bon marché dans son milieu. Hortense est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Hortense N., age 53 years, sells drinks and doughnuts in front of her house. She is president of her group known as "Esengo Plus", which means in English "More Joy". The group is composed of 26 micro-entrepreneurs united together to contract loans through Kiva and the IMF HOPE RDC. Hortense is determined to realize her ambition to open a drink delivery service for her customers in her neighborhood and the surrounding area. Her business grows well thanks to the 4 loans that she already has received from IMF HOPE RDC. The next loan will allow for her to diversify her products, buying 3 baskets of fresh fish, which constitutes an good deal in her area. Hortense is married and is the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nyetaa est composé de cinq  femmes toutes mariées qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles  ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants  et habitent dans le quartier Bozo à Diamarabougou Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe se sont connus par des liens professionnels, de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes bozos qui existait  depuis  plus de 10 ans.
Après 4 prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, ce groupe est à son cinquième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso..
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 12 cartons de poissons fumés et 800kg de poissons frais. Ces poissons sont triés selon les espèces et ensuite destinées soit à la vente  frais soit à la friture soit au  fumage ou au séchage. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés à Macina (Mignon et Diado), en poissons frais sur place à Markala au bord du fleuve Niger au niveau du pont, dans les zones de pêche de Markala et à Niono (Dora). Les poissons sont vendus à Bamako, à Ségou (marché du château) et sur place à Markala sous toutes les formes, frais, frits, fumés et séchés au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles disposent de  fours et séchoirs traditionnels spécialement conçus dans un coin de leurs cours pour le fumage et le séchage des poissons. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 83 500 FCFA qui servira d’épargne en vue de l’achat de congélateur, à la contribution d’achat de matériels de pêche pour leurs maris, à la participation aux évènements sociaux (baptêmes, mariages et funérailles) et aux petites dépenses familiales notamment (savon, habillements).
Elles ambitionnent acheter  chacune un congélateur afin de diminuer les charges.
texts.en:
Nyetaa Group is composed of five married women who live in large traditional expanded families. On average, they are 39 years old and have three children. They live in the neighborhood of Bozo in the city of Diamarabougou Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through professional or family links; they are members of the same traditional association of women from Bozo, which has existed for over ten years. They have repaid without difficulty their previous four group loans and are now applying for their fifth group loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

They will use this loan to buy 12 boxes of smoked fish and 800 kg of fresh fish. The fish will be sorted and then either sold fresh or fried, smoked or dried. They get their supply of smoked fish in Macina (Mignon and Diado) and of fresh fish on location in Markala on the banks of the River Niger, near the bridge, in the fishery zones of Markala and in Niono (Dora). The fish, whether fresh, fried, smoked or dried, will be sold in Bamako, at the Castle Market in Ségou and on location in Markala, for cash and seldom on credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They have at their disposal in their backyards traditional specialized ovens and dryers to smoke and dry their fish.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 83,500 CFA francs (US$191). They will save this money to buy freezers, to help their husbands to buy fishery material, to take part in social events (baptisms, weddings and funerals) and to pay small household expenses, in particular soap and clothing. Their ambition is to buy, each of them, a freezer to bring down their expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Be Strong Group

texts.en:
'Be Strong' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Gayduo K., 38 years old, a widow with 3 children aged 5 -12 years old. Their educational levels are 1st -8th grade. She also cares for an orphan. She is an illiterate due to poverty. Gayduo and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close to Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Gayduo’s business is her general goods sales. She buys general goods like seasonings, both bath and bar soaps, dry fish, etc. wholesale and sells retail on a table to residents of Ziggida Town. She has been running this business for 3 years and is hoping to expand to a bigger table. She talks to her customers very politely in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Gayduo and her children depend on this business for their day-to-day needs because she doesn’t have a helper; therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more general goods like seasonings, bar soaps, detergents, etc. wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: to purchase more  general goods  wholesale to expand her business

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar, 38 years old, is married and the mother of four children. She is a hard-working business woman. She enjoys selling goods. She sells cosmetics and that has been her major source of livelihood for the past six years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers.

Hagar does not have a shop now, so she sells on top of a table at the community market. She believes that with the loan, she will be able to purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory and income, for that matter.

loans.use: To buy more  cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso.

Margaret is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also hawks to sell it in her community. Margaret buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: D. Denise est née en 1976 à Adja au Mono. Denise réside depuis vingt neuf ans dans le quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NOUMON André un mécanicien moto, Denise a à sa charge cinq enfants, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et sont à la charge de Denise et de André. Denise n’a jamais été à l’école, c’est pourquoi elle s’est très tôt mise dans la vente de produits vivriers (riz, maïs, haricot) à son domicile. Denise vend également des boissons et de l’eau glacée. Denise achète les produits vivriers à Adja au Mono et s’approvisionne en boissons à la Société Béninoise de Brasserie du Bénin. Denise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour accroître son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients et obtenir plus d’économies, Denise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Denise D. was born in 1976 in Adja au Mono. Denise has lived for 19 years in the Cadjèhoun à Cotonou neighborhood, economic capital of Bénin. She is married to André Noumon, a bike mechanic, Denise has five children in her care, of which four are her own children. All of the children attend school and are dependent on Denise and André. Denise never went to school, because she began at an early age to sell provisions (rice, corn, beans) from her home. Denise also sells drinks and frozen water. Denise buys the provisions in Adja au Mono and obtains the drinks from the Benin Brewery Corporation of Benin. Denise is a former client of ALIDé who has already benefited from three loans that she repaid well to ALIDé. In order to increase her working capital so she can better satisfy her clients and earn more profits, Denise requests a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, corn and beans for resale

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She sells men's clothing at the central market. Irina has been in this business for 7 years. She has used Kiva loans before and always paid them back on time.

Irina finds such loans very helpful for her business development. The loans allow her to increase sales and receive additional income. This time Irina would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her assortment. She wants to spend additional income to purchase some home equipment.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: V. Antoinette  est née le 13 Novembre 1974 et réside depuis huit ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KOUDEDJAN Germain un géomètre, Antoinette a quatre enfants à sa charge, dont trois sont ses propres enfants.  Antoinette vit seule avec ses enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées à la fois par Germain et Antoinette. Ayant arrêté très tôt les études, Antoinette s’est mise depuis vingt ans dans la vente de chaussures, de sous-vêtements et de sel de cuisine. En effet, Antoinette fait ses emplettes à Grand-Popo, à Dantokpa (marché international du Bénin) et à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Antoinette vend ses articles au marché Gbégamey et à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Antoinette a déjà obtenu trois crédits de ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pour augmenter le niveau de son activité afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de réaliser plus de bénéfices,  Antoinette sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Antoinette V. was born November 13, 1974 and has lived for eight years in the Cadjèhoun à Cotonou neighborhood, economic capital of Benin. She is married to Germain Koudedjan, a surveyor, Antoinette has four children in her care, of which three are her own children. Antoinette lives alone with her children who all attend school. The family expenses are shared by German and Antoinette. Having quit her studies very early, Antoinette has dedicated herself to selling shoes, under-garmetns and kitchen salt for twenty years. In fact, Antoinette makes her purchases at Grand-Popo, in Dantokpa (the international market of Benin) and in Lomé in Togo, a neighboring country of Benin. Antoinette sells her items in the Gbégamey market and in Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Antoinette already has obtained three loans from ALIDé that she repaid well. To grow her business, increase her sales and realize more profits, Antoinette requests a fourth loan of ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, scarves and under-garments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera. (To purchase a dairy cow)

loans.name: Wanayezee Group

texts.en:
Wanayezee is a group of 5 borrowers led by Luyakoi K., 30 years old, married with 2 children aged 1 and 3 years old;  the kids are not yet in school. She is an illiterate due to poverty. Luyakoi and her family live in the Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Luyakoi’s business is her palm oil sales. She buys palm oil from farmers wholesale and sells it retail in bottles to residents of Ziggida town Lofa County, northern Liberia. She has been running this business for 2 years and is hoping to improve to a bigger table. She talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Luyakoi and her family depend on this business for their daily needs, therefore; she needs this loan in order to purchase more palm oil wholesale to improve business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil wholesale to improve business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora EMERITA, tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 4to de Primaria. Se caso a la edad de 16 años y tiene 3 hijos todos menores y se encuentran estudiando por lo cual dependen económicamente de ella . EMERITA se dedica a la plantación de eucalipto (planta medicinal) en la chacra de caratas para luego venderlo al por mayor en su pueblo y en pueblos aledaños . Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró semillas, abono y bolsas para la plantación.
Con este crédito de 300  nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono, semillas y bolsas para la plantación de su eucalipto. La socia sueña con tener una buena cosecha y así obtener dinero para su gastos y estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emerita is 35 years old, lives in the Trujillo district, province of Trujillo, in the city of La Libertad - Peru. She is a member of the San Luis Community Bank and has a 4th grade education. She was married at 16 years of age and has 3 children who are economically dependent on her. Emerita works at planting eucalyptus (which is a medicinal plant) on a farm and then sells it wholesale in her town and surrounding villages. With her first loan of 300 soles ($125 USD), she bought seeds, fertilizer and bags, which helps her in the planting of eucalyptus. With this loan, she plans to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer, seeds and bags for her eucalyptus business. Emerita dreams of having a good harvest, so that she can bring in money for their expenses and for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprará sacos de abono, semillas y bolsas para la plantación de su eucalipto (To purchase fertilizer, seed and bags for her eucalyptus business)

loans.name: Ablawa Antoinette

texts.fr: K. Ablawa Antoinette est née en 1955 et vit depuis trente sept ans à Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ablawa Antoinette est mariée à ADJAMAYISSO Athanas, un menuisier. Le couple a cinq enfants dont trois sont à leurs charges. Ablawa Antoinette vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Ablawa Antoinette a arrêté les classes au primaire et depuis dix ans, elle s'est mise dans la vente de farine de manioc, de l'arachide grillé ainsi que d’huile d’arachide et d’huile de palme à son domicile. Ablawa Antoinette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits et qui a bien remboursé son crédit. Ablawa Antoinette sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour accroître son fonds de roulement et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Ablawa Antoinette K. was born in 1955 and has lived for thirty seven years in Cadjehoun à Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Ablawa Antoinette is married to Athanas Adjamayisso, a carpenter. The couple has five children of which three are still in their care. Ablawa Antoinette lives together with her spouse and her children that all attend school. The family expenses are borne by the two spouses. Ablawa Antoinette quit primary school and, for ten years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of manioc flour, roasted groundnuts as well as groundnut oil and palm oil from her residence. Ablawa Antoinette supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of the Benin. She is a former customer of ALIDé that already has benefited from three loans, which she repaid well. Ablawa Antoinette requests a fourth loan from ALIDé, to increase her working capital and increase her sales.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manioc flour, and cans of palm oil and groundnut oil for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora MARIA P. Z., tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS. Ella  presenta estudios  hasta 4to de Primaria y  tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de leña y cerveza .Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro leña al por mayor para venderla en su casa y pueblos aledaños.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará leña y cajas de cerveza al por mayor. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener dinero para educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria P. Z. is 33 years old. She lives in the Trujillo district of the province of Trujillo, in the State of La Libertad, Peru. This associate is part of the “San Luis” communal bank. She has completed studies up to the 4th grade of primary school and has 2 children of 9 and 12 years of age who are her economic dependants. This associate is in the business of buying and selling firewood and beer. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought firewood at wholesale in order to sell it at home and in surrounding towns. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy firewood and cases of beer at wholesale. This associate dreams of increasing her sales in order to earn money for educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: will purchase firewood and cases of beer at wholesale

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: Melida es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, Melida  es costurera y también se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, néctares y refrescos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la compra-venta de productos regionales. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ”Mujeres Trabajadoras” desde hace nueve años,  el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 que lo invirtió en productos para su bodega, pues antes se dedicaba a este negocio, en la actualidad Melida  necesita un crédito de 2500 soles que será utilizado  una parte para comprar telas, botones, hilos, elásticos, para la confección de blusas y otra parte será invertido en la compra de bebidas. La meta de Melida es tener un taller de costura bien implementado para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melinda is a hard-working, active woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and the mother of two adult children. She is a seamstress but also sells soft drinks, fruit juices, and other beverages. Her husband, who works in sales of regional products, supports her work. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" communal bank for the last 9 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy stock for her store for she used to have a grocery store. Currently, Melinda needs a 2500 sol loan part of which will be used to buy fabric, buttons, thread and elastic which she will use to sew blouses and the other part will be used to buy beverages. Melinda's goal is to have a well-equipped clothes-making shop from which to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part to purchase fabric, buttons, thread and elastic for use in sewing blouses and part to buy beverages.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una socia alegre y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años D. edad, madre tres hijos, todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. comida por las mañanas, actividad que lo realiza todos los días D. la semana en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es chofer D. autos. Rosa integra el Banco Comunal ”Mujeres Valientes” desD. hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que obtuvo le permitió invertir en alimento balanceado para pollos, actividad que realizaba antes y los vendía en el mercado, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. mesas, sillas, manteles y utensilios para su negocio D. venta D. comida. La meta D.  Rosa es tener un restaurante  y  salir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a happy and dynamic associate who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 57 years old and the mother of three grown children. She concentrates on selling food in the mornings which she does from her home each day of the week, counting on the support of her husband who is a car driver. Rosa has been a member of the "Mujeres Valientes" Communal Bank for four years. The first loan she received allowed her to invest in balanced feed for chickens, which she used to sell in the market. Currently she needs a loan of 1300 soles that will let her invest in the purchase of tables, chairs, tablecloths and utensils for her food business. Rosa's goal is to own a restaurant and move ahead in her work.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths and utensils for her business

loans.name: Sanka Yuri Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Sanka Yuri”, trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas  de dos años, se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal  Collpani, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Celia es la actual presidenta, afirma que gracias  a Pro-Mujer, hallo  la opción de iniciar un negocio propio, esto le permitió apoyar a su familia con los gastos que tienen en su hogar. Este grupo tiene diferentes negocios, por ejemplo, Petrona vende comida, Albertina tienen una librería, Lucia vende mantas tejidas en lana de vicuña, Reina elabora y vende comida rápida.  Todas afirman que necesitan créditos para la compra mercadería o insumos.
texts.en:
The Sanka Yuri Association has worked together with Pro-Mujer for over two years. They meet every other week in the Collpani focal center, located in the city of El Alto. Celia is the current president, and says that thanks to Pro-Mujer she encountered the opportunity to start her own business which has enabled her to support her family with household expenses. This group has various businesses. For example, Petrona sells food, Albertina has a bookstore, Lucia sells blankets woven from vicuña wool, and Reina makes and sells fast food. All state that they need loans for the purchase of merchandise or supplies.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise or supplies

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: K. Elisabeth est née en 1958 et réside depuis trente ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elisabeth est mariée à KIKISOME Louis, un chauffeur. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. Elisabeth et Louis supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Elisabeth n’a jamais été à l’école et s’est mise depuis vingt cinq ans à vendre du sel de cuisine, du savon, des conserves (tomates en boîtes, sardines, lait) de façon ambulante. Elisabeth mène également comme activité secondaire la vente du jus de bissap et de l’eau glacée. Elisabeth s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Afin d’agrandir le volume de son activité et réaliser plus d'économies qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Elisabeth sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born in 1958 and has lived for thirty years in the Cadjehoun à Cotonou neighborhood , economic capital of Benin. Elisabeth is married to Louis Kikisome, a driver. The couple has six children all attending school and living with them. Elisabeth and Louis bear together the family expenses. Elisabeth never attended school and has dedicated herself for twenty five years to selling kitchen salt, soap, canned foods (tomatoes in cans, sardines, milk) by travelling from place to place. As secondary activity, Elisabeth sells bissap juice and frozen water. Elisabeth purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a former customer of ALIDé, who has already obtained three loans that she repaid well. In order to grow the volume of her business and realize more profits that will allow her to provide the necessities for her family, Elisabeth requests a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various supplies (sardines, tomatos in can, soap, milk, sugar packages)

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: G. Jocelyne est née en 1947 et vit depuis trente neuf ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jocelyne est une veuve ayant trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont à sa charge. Seule Jocelyne supporte les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Jocelyne s’est mise depuis vingt ans dans la vente de maïs, de bois de chauffage et a également une cabine téléphonique où elle vend des recharges téléphoniques à la devanture de sa maison. Jocelyne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Jocelyne sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour accroitre son activité et satisfaire la demande nombreuse de ses clients.
texts.en:
Jocelyne G. was born in 1947 and has lived for thirty nine years in the Cadjehoun neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Jocelyne is a widow with three children who are in school, two of whom she is supporting. Jocelyne meets the family's expenses alone. To meet her childrens' needs Jocelyne started selling corn and firewood twenty years ago, and she also has a telephone booth in front of her house where she sells telephone airtime refills. Jocelyne gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She is a former client of Alidé, having benefited from three loans that she repaid correctly to Alidé. Jocelyne is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé to increase her business and to meet the numerous needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase telephone refill cards, bags of corn, and firewood

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Al vivienda del señor Israel B. le está haciendo falta el techo de dos cuartos pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de poner el techo ya que lo quiere de concreto para que sea más duradero y seguro para su familia ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños de edad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como jardinero del municipio, ya que su esposa la señora Luz Del Carmen Hernández se encargara de los gastos familiares con su ingreso que tiene como de su trabaja como veladora de una compañía. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Luz Del Carmen Hernández esposa del señor Israel ya que el se encontraba en su trabaja cuando se realizo la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Mr. Israel Bermudez is missing the roof over the bedrooms. At this time, because he wants it built from concrete so that it will be longer lasting and safer for his family and three young children, he lacks the money necessary to pay the person who will be in charge of putting on the roof. Since his wife Mrs. Luz Del Carmen Hernandez will be taking care of the family expenses with the income from her job as watchperson for a company, he plans on paying this loan with the income from his job as municipal gardener. Because he was at work when the visit was made, the person who appears in the picture is Mrs. Luz Del Carmen Hernandez, wife of Israel.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: placement of concrete tile

loans.name: Magnolia Del Carmen

texts.es: Magnolia es una persona dinámica y  trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años y es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son mayores de edad. Magnolia  se dedica a la venta de sandalias, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo en el mercado número dos de esta localidad y por las noches ella se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en  la compra de gaseosa para vender, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que utilizará en la compra de sandalias al por mayor, ya que viajará a la ciudad de Lima a comrparlas. La meta de Magnolia es tener una tienda de calzados, carteras y accesorios.
texts.en:
Magnolia is a dynamic, hard-working, 44-year-old, mother of four children, three of whom are adults. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region where, together with her husband, sells sandals in the local market. During the evening she sells prepared food from her home. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Virtuosas" communal bank for the last 8 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to purchase soft drinks to sell. Now, she needs a 1500 sol loan which will be used to buy sandals at wholesale since she will travel to Lima to buy them there. Her goal is to have a store specializing in footwear, purses and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale sandals.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio tiene 46 años, es padre de 6 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia. En vista de que no cuenta con tierras cultivables, ni recursos suficientes, siembra a medias; es decir, tiene un socio que pone las chacra y la semilla;  y él, el trabajo desde la siembra hasta la cosecha. También cría vacas y una vez que tienen un buen tamaño las vende para cubrir sus necesidades económicas. La crianza de animales le resulta muy rentable porque compra becerritos y los alimenta con abundante avena, asimismo los sujeta en las zonas de abundante pasto para que se desarrollen rápidamente y los pueda vender, y recupere su inversión. 

A Amancio le gusta criar sus animales y dedicarse a sus cultivos, ya que estas labores son su principal fuente de ingresos económicos, con las que educa y alimenta a sus hijos. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y su mayor atención se ha centrado en los ahorros que puede tener en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Amancio is 46 years old and has 6 children who live with him in the house that he owns. He does not have farmable lands nor enough resources, so he has a partner who supplies the land and seeds, and Amancio does the planting and harvesting. He also raises cows, and once they’re large enough, he sells them to cover his expenses. Raising animals has proven profitable for him, as he purchases calves and feeds them with plenty of oats, as well as letting them graze in areas with abundant grasses, so they may develop quickly and he can sell them to regain his investment. Amancio likes to raise animals and dedicate himself to his crops, and his attention has been focused on his labors, as they are his main source of income, which he uses to educate and feed his children. This is his first loan from MFP and his primary focus has been the savings he can have with his community bank. The money he is requesting will be used to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Zoñith

texts.es: Zoñith es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el caserío Señor D. los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Campo VerD. región D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad,  ella se dedica a la siembra D. arroz, frejol, plátanos, yuca y frutas, trabaja junto con su esposo en esta actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor D. los Milagros” desD. hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 500 soles que invirtió en la compra D. animales como, pollos, patos, carneros para criar y posteriormente  venderlos en la ciudad D. Pucallpa.  Actualmente ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar un motocarro D. segunda mano ya que le hace falta. La meta D. Zoñith es tener una tienda D. venta D. repuestos y lubricantes D. motos y motokar.
texts.en:
Zoñith is a hard-working, dynamic, 57-year-old, mother of 4 adult children. She lives in the Señor D. los Milagros hamlet which is in the Campo VerD. district, Ucayali region. She farms rice, beans, plantain, yucca and fruits. She works alongsiD. her husband. She has been a member of the “Mi Señor D. los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. Her first 500 sol loan was used to buy small farm animals like chickens, ducks, and lambs to raise and then sell in the city of Pucallpa. Currently, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a used three-wheel motor van which she needs. Her goal is to have a store specializing in replacement parts and lubricants for motorcycles and three-wheel motor vans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a used three-wheel motorvan.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Él trabaja en las chacras de sus vecinos como jornalero, por lo que le pagan 18 soles cada día. También siembra papa, lechugas y arvejas en chacras alquiladas, pagando por el alquiler desde 600 hasta 1000 soles, dependiendo la dimensión del terreno. Su cultivo preferido es la arveja, ya no requiere de mucha inversión en los fertilizantes, pero debe sembrarlas en chacras donde hayan sido cosechadas las papas anteriormente, de esa manera ahorra muchísimo. Durante la primera recolección sus arvejas son grandes y abundantes, las cuales comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad en menos de 20 minutos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que Ernesto hace el compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insecticidas para sus chacras de arvejas.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 40 years old, lives in his own home with his partner and mother of their 5 children. He works on his neighbors' farm land as a day laborer for which he earns 18 soles per day. He also plants potatoes, lettuces, and peas on rented farm land paying from 600 to 1000 soles for the rental, depending on the size of the plot. His favorite crop is peas since they require little investment in fertilizers but he must plant them on land that has previously been used to grow potatoes therby saving much. During the first harvest of his peas, they are large and abundant and he sells them in the city's wholesale market in less than 20 minutes. This is his first loan with MFP for which Ernesto pledges to make his repayments on time. The funds he asks for will be used to purchase insecticides for his pea plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Flor De Jacinto Group

texts.es:
Juana J. M. tiene 43 años, es representante de la Familia Emprendedora Flor de Jacinto; en este tipo de grupo los prestatarios son familiares pero cada uno de ellos tiene su propio negocio. Juana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, inició con el negocio porque su esposo fue despedido e invirtió el dinero de la liquidación en su pequeño negocio. La tienda es la principal fuente de ingreso para su hogar y como actividad extra, su esposo se dedica a la compra-venta de madera; invierten aproximadamente 5,000 pesos por cada pedido de madera.

Juana tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos en la universidad, otro en la preparatoria y el último en la secundaria. Necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijol, aceite, leche y otros productos básicos. 

La señora quiere que sus hijos terminen su carrera y por eso trabaja con esfuerzo y dedicación para que tengan éxito en un futuro. También obtiene ingresos de la cría de cerdos. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de abarrote amplia para hacer frente a la competencia que enfrenta en su comunidad. 


Lucía G. R., pertenece al grupo de Juana tiene 47 años y se dedica a la venta de pozol que es la bebida tradicional de la zona y a la elaboración de productos artesanales (bolsas, tortilleras, moisés y abanicos entre otros). Comenzó con el negocio de venta de pozol desde hace aproximadamente 20 años.

Lucía necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, cacao y leña para seguir vendiendo pozol además quiere comprar una balanza ya que para realizar sus ventas tiene que pedir prestada la balanza a un vecino.

Tiene 3 hijos que estudian la universidad por lo que necesita invertir más en su negocio. Con la compra de la balanza se le facilitaría su actividad pues ya no tendría que desplazarse para pesar su producto en casa del vecino, sus principales clientes son las personas de la comunidad. 

Actualmente ella vende sus productos en su casa y sueña con tener un local a lado de sus domicilio para establecer hay su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana J. M. is 43 years old and is the representative of the enterprising family Flor de Jacinto; in this type of group the borrowers are family members but each one of them has his or her own business. Juana sells groceries. She started the business because her husband lost his job and then his severance pay was invested into the small business. The store is the principal source of income for the household and as an extra activity, her husband buys and sells wood; they invest approximately 5,000 pesos for each order of wood.

Juana has 3 children, one is at a university, one is in high school and one is in middle school. She needs the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, oil, milk and other basic products.

Juana wants her children to be able to finish their studies and for this reason she works with a lot of effort and dedication so they can have success in the future. She also earns income from raising pigs. She dreams of having a large grocery store in order to contend with the competition in her community.

Lucía G. R. belongs to Juana’s Group, she is 47 years old and sells pozol which is the traditional drink of the region as well as artisanal crafts ( bags, tortilla baskets, baby cradles and fans among other crafts) She started her pozol selling business approximately 20 years ago.

Luica needs the loan in order to buy corn, cacao and firewood to continue selling pozol. She also wants to buy a scale; for now, in order for her to complete her orders, she has to borrow a scale from a neighbor.

She has 3 children studying in university; for this reason she needs to invest more in her business. The purchase of the scale would make things easier so she wouldn’t have go to her neighbor’s house to weigh her products; her main clients are the people in her community.

Currently she sells her products at home and has dreams of having a place next to her home to set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products: sugar, rice, beans, salt, oil, soap, milk

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad es una mujer trabajadora  y activa, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali,  tiene 29 años  y es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos para vender en el mercado de Campo verde, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de tablas de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en alimentos balanceado para pollos, en la actualidad Soledad necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar alimento balanceado para animales menores.  La meta de Soledad es tener una fuente de soda y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Soledad is an active, hardworking woman. She lives in the community of Señor de los Milagros which is located in the district of Campo Verde in the region of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two young children. She works raising chickens to sell in the market of Campo Verde. She counts on the help of her husband who works selling wood planks. She has been part of the Community Bank Mi Señor de los Milagros (My Father of the Miracles) for about a year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she invested in balanced feed for her chickens. Now Soledad needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be used to buy balanced feed for small animals. Soledad's goal is to have a soda fountain and continue to support her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Ella se dedica a la siembra de papas, arvejas y maíz en chacras arrendadas, de las cuales le cobran por la cantidad de semillas que ingresa en la chacra (40 soles por saco), pagando en total de 1000 a 1200 soles por siembra. Para sacar el alquiler y las ganancias Guillermina trabaja muchísimo con su esposo desde las 5 de la mañana.

Su actividad agrícola es muy sacrificada, pero también muy gratificante, ya que gracias a la buena producción logró adquirir un carro, con el que ahora lleva su carga y la de sus vecinos, siendo su esposo el conductor. Una vez en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad vende las papas y arvejas por sacos, en el caso del maíz lo vende en mazorcas, como nos muestra en la foto, a 2 soles cada uno.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas a su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus siembras de papa.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 44 years old and lives with her partner and father of their 4 children. She farms potatoes, beans and corn on rented farm land for which she is charged rent according to the number of sacks of seed she brings into the farm (40 soles per sack) paying a total of about 1000 to 1200 soles per planting. In order to net enough to pay for the rental and have some profit, Guillermina, together with her husband, works very hard starting at 5 a.m. Her farming work is very strenuous but also very gratifying since, thanks to the good yields, she was able to acquire a car with which she now transports her own and her neighbors' loads; her husband being the driver. Once in the city's wholesale market she sells the potatoes and beans by the sackfull. In the corn's case she sells it still on the cob, as shown in the photo, for 2 soles each. This is her first loan with MFP for which she pledges to make all her repayments to the communal bank on time. The funds she is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es una socia dinámica y activa, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años madre D. seis hijos todos mayores D. edad, Eulogia se dedica a la venta D. leche fresca, queso y manjar blanco (dulce D. leche), ella venD. sus productos en el mercado Nro 2  D. esta localidad, su es poso esta delicado D. salud por lo que ahora ella sola trabaja para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que obtuvo en este banco fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en frutas.
Actualemnte ella requiere un crédito D. 1300 soles que será utilizado para comprar insumos para la elaboración D. yogurt, manjar blanco.  La meta D. Eulogia es tener una tienda para vender estos productos,  ya que ella venD. en el exterior del mercado y no tiene un local establecido.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a dynamic and active member of CrediMUJER. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 63 years old and the mother of 6 grown children.

Eulogia’s business is the sale of fresh milk, cheese, and manjar blanco (a Peruvian sweet milk dish). She sells her products in the local market. Because her husband is in bad health, she is the only one providing for the family.

For 8 years, Eulogia has been a member of the Communal Bank’s “Productive Women.” Her first loan with this bank was for 300 soles, which she used to buy fruit. This loan, for 1300 soles, will be used for supplies to make yogurt and manjar blanco.

Eugenia’s goal is to have her own store to sell her products. Currently she has to sell outsiD. the market and does not have a permanent location.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supplies for making yogurt and manjar blanco

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides es una mujer de 52 años, tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con la última en su casa propia. Los trabajos agrícolas los realiza en compañía de su pareja, siembra arvejas, papas y lechugas. En el caso de la hortaliza prefiere cultivarla a medias porque le parece muy trabajoso y se requiera de muchas paciencia; por ello ella le da el terreno y semillas a otra persona (su socio) y él es el encargado de hacerla producir. 
Mientras eso, Leonides está avocada al cultivo de sus papas y arvejas, y luego de tres meses aproximadamente, cuando sus lechugas están listas, junto a su socio, realizan la cosecha, que posteriormente envía a uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Lima y si es época de verano, sus ganancias son mayores.

Leonides está muy feliz de contar con un socio honesto y que le retribuye logrando que su producción aumente.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella fue quien organizó a todos sus compañeros para formar su propio banco comunal, donde aparte de obtener un crédito cuentan con un seguro de vida y esto es uno de los aspectos que más le gusta a Leonides. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para su próxima siembra de lechugas.
texts.en:
Leonides is a 52-year-old woman. She has 3 children, but only lives with the youngest, in her own home. Together with her partner, she cultivates peas, potatoes and lettuces. In the case of the lettuces, she prefers to only tend them half-way because she feels they are very labor intensive and require a lot of patience. For that reason, she passes on the land and the seed to another person (her partner) and he is then in charge of making it productive. Meanwhile, Leonidas focuses on the potatoes and peas. In about three months, when the lettuces are ready, together with her partner, they harvest their products which are then sent to one of the markets in Lima. If it's Summer season, their profits are larger. Leonides is very happy to count on an honest partner who repays her by producing a larger yield. This is her first loan with MFP. It was she who organized all her associates to form their own communal bank where, besides being able to secure loans, they also have life insurance and this is one of the features that Leonidas likes best of all. The funds she is seeking now will be used to buy seed for her next lettuce planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, madre de seis hijos, todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, la tienda funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  quien es obrero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en golosinas para vender, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos de primera necesidad como fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc. La meta de Rosa es ampliar su negocio y seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of our dynamic members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. Rosa is 61 years old and the mother of 6 adult children. She sells groceries from her store that she operates out of her home. She has the support of her husband, who works as a laborer.

Rosa became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (Virtuous Women) four years ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and used to purchase candy for resale. At the moment, she needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy basic necessities such as noodles, rice, sugar, etc. Rosa’s goal is to expand her business and continue increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities such as noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: La Luna Nueva Group

texts.es:
La   señora Dolores Alarcón C. es originaria de un pueblito muy pequeño escondido entre los cerros  llamado Buenos Aires ubicado en el estado de Oaxaca, ella es madre soltera de 2 niños  pequeños  hasta hace poco trabajaba en otra comunidad retirada de su hogar  como empleada domestica para solventar los gastos de su familia  pero descuidaba  asus pequeños hijos, hace 5 meses ella decidió emprender un negocio propio es la venta venta de antojitos típicos de la región y venta de carne de pollo lamentablemente es muy costoso trasladarse de su hogar a acatlàn de Pérez  Figueroa a conseguir el pollo en pluma para venderlo en su comunidad por tal motivo ella solicito un crédito por que  ella desea hacer una pequeña granjita ahorrase los gastos de traslado y  así poder estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos y asegurarles una educación y prepáralos para un futuro mejor . Con el préstamo  la señora Dolores comprara pollos en pluma, bebederos y alimento. Mismo motivo por el cual la señora  Dolores  se unió al grupo La L. nueva para solicitar el crédito grupal a Fundación Realidad A.C. los  otros  miembros  del grupo son:

1.-Margarita A.  Ladino______venta de dulces.
2.-Silvia García Hernández_______venta de comida.
3.-Noemí O. Solís__________venta de comida.
4.-Martha C. Perea__________venta de refresco y molino de nixtamal.
5.-Benito Alarcón González_______venta  de maíz y fríjol.
6.-Felicitas Alarcón L.._________venta de refrescos.
7.-Bernarda M. Méndez_______venta de ropa.
8.-Juana C. González___________venta de maíz.
9.-Benigna C. Perea__________venta de cerdos.
10.-Victoria Sánchez  Martínez_____venta de antojitos.
11.-Cirila Gómez Ramírez_________venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores Alarcón C. is originally from a small town hidden in the Buenos Aires hills in the state of Oaxaca and is the single mother of two young children.
