Patricia is 43 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She divides her time between her household chores and her job as a housekeeper. She has been cleaning houses for several years while raising her 3 children. She is requesting a loan to pay educational expenses for one of them.

Patricia appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses for one of her children

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora Herlinda Gómez le está haciendo falta cambiar los cables de la luz y reparación de las puertas pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible.
Doña Herlinda se dedica a la venta de bolsa, perfumes, lentes del sol, productos para la belleza, este es el ingreso que ella tiene para su familia ya solo viven ella y una hija.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora ya que le preocupa porque tiene nietos pequeños y teme que les pueda pasar algo.
texts.en:
At the home of Sra. Herlinda Gómez, the wiring for her lights needs to be changed and all of the doors are in need of repair. However, she does not have the money needed to make these improvements immediately. Doña Herlinda sells purses, perfumes, sunglasses, and beauty products. This is how she earns income for her family, which consists of herself and her daughter. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials and pay someone to make the repairs. She is concerned because she has young grandchildren and fears that something might happen to them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the wiring for the lights & repair the doors of the house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma, pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 41 años de edad, ella es soltera,  la socia  es dueña de una tienda abarrotes, ella está en este tipo de comercio desde hace muchos años, conociendo íntegramente el manejo de su negocio, nuestra socia desea implementar su tienda y hacerla más productiva, la socia requiere el préstamo para así poder reinvertir en su negocio y comprar más mercadería para abastecer de productos su tienda.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member Norma belongs to the Kantu San Jerónimo Community Bank and is a native of the city of Cusco.

Norma is 41 years old, single, and owns a grocery store. She has been in this type of commerce for many years, understanding intimately how to manage her business. She wishes to expand her store and make it more productive. She needs a loan to reinvest in her business and buy more merchandise to supply her store with products.

Norma appreciates and values the loan which is being offered through this means, and she commits herself to make her payments in the time established.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO RESUPPLY HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Maisa

texts.es:
Maisa tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la ayudaron para salir adelante y lo que más desea es darle una buena vida a su pequeño hijo.
Los percances que Maisa ha sufrido, no han hecho que sus esfuerzos de mejorar su calidad de vida disminuyan, ni siquiera la quiebra reciente de su restaurante, ha hecho que deje de trabajar muy duro. Es por eso que decidió comprar, con los pocos ahorros que tenía, un carrito salchipapero (movil para la preparación y venta de salchipapas: salchichas y papas fritas), el cual le está dando muy buenos resultados, ya que le brinda los ingresos que necesita para vivir.

Lo que más le gusta de su nuevo trabajo es que tiene las mañanas libres para poder cuidar a su querido hijo, lleva 6 meses realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer hasta altas horas de la noche en la calle vendiendo. Con el paso del tiempo, espera poder comprar más aditamentos para su carrito salchipapero para poder vender otros platillos adicionales.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Maisa con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se llegan en las reuniones de su grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para realizar sus salchipapas.
texts.en:
Maisa, age 23, is a very hardworking and happy young woman. She lives in her parents’ house and they always helped her to get ahead. What she desires most is to give a good life to her little son.

The setbacks that Maisa has suffered haven’t diminished her efforts to improve her quality of life. Not even the recent failure of her restaurant has made her give up working very hard. That’s why she decided to use her small savings to buy a cart which allows the mobile preparation of “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). This is giving her very good results since it provides her the income she needs to live. What she likes most about her new work is that she has the morning free in order to be able to care for her dear son. She has been in this business for 6 months and feels that the most difficult part is having to stay in the streets selling until very late at night. With the passage of time she hopes to be able to purchase more equipment for her cart in order to be able to sell other, additional dishes.

This is Maisa’s fourth loan with MFP, and, just as she did with her prior loans, she hopes to be able to make her payments on time. She is very happy in her communal bank and is always concerned about reaching the agreements which they arrive at in meetings of the group. With the one thousand soles she is applying for she will buy more ingredients for making her salchipapas.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El socio Leopoldo, pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural del distrito de Anta en lka provincia del  Cusco.

Nuestro socio  tiene 32 años de edad, el es casada y tiene 2 hijos, nuestro socio radica en la ciudad del Cusco y alterna sus actividades con la mecánica, el socio es de profesión mecánico y realiza trabajos en su área y desea el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio y de esta manera producir más.

Nuestro socio valora y agradece el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leopoldo, a partner of the “KANTU SAN JERONIMO” communal bank, comes from the Anta district in the Ika province of Cusco. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. He's based in the city of Cusco and mixes his activities with mechanics as he's a mechanic by profession and carries out work in his area. Leopoldo would like the loan to be able to invest in his business and thereby produce more. He appreciates and is grateful for the loan which will offer him such means and commits to repay his instalments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in mechanics

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una buena vejez. El trabajo para Nancy siempre fue una actividad muy digna, es por eso que trabaja sin complejos atendiendo un restaurante, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que es uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. 
Su labor consiste en atender a los clientes, servirles y cobrar, actividades que ella realiza muy bien y con mucha amabilidad, motivos por el cual es una de las empleadas más eficientes del restaurante.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a tantas personas a la vez, lo cual la cansa mucho. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de Nancy con MFP y espera pode pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil soles solicitados planea incrementar sus ahorros para posteriormente implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Nancy, 34, is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She lives in the house of her parents, whom she wants to give a good old age. Work has always been a very respectable activity for Nancy and because of this she works without complex serving in a restaurant, which is always very crowded being one of the best-known restaurants in the city of Juliaca.

Her work consists of attending to clients and serving and collecting payment from them, activities which she does very well and with much kindness. For this reason, she is one of the most efficient employees of the restaurant. She has been doing this kind of work for 4 years and most enjoys making conversation with her clients. She finds the hardest thing is attending to so many people at the same time, and this makes her very tired.

This is the second loan for Nancy with MFP and she expects to be able to pay it back on time, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of the communal bank, where she is well-liked and respected. With the 1,000 soles requested, she plans to increase her savings to subsequently set up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment in her restaurant

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en una casa alquilada y tiene muchas ganas de sobre salir en la vida. En el barrio Zarumilla de la ciudad de Juliaca, Virginia tiene una tienda, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas; como cerveza, gaseosas, vinos, piscos, etc, los cuales son rápidamente consumidos, por sus vecinos, ya que Virginia tiene la fama de vender sólo bebidas de buena calidad y no adulteradas.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche atendiendo a algunos clientes que desean sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea hacer arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda, para poder brindarles a sus clientes una mejor atención. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de Virginia con MFP y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil soles que solicita comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda, con la cual podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Virginia, 51, is a very hard-working and determined woman. She rents a house and very much wants to make something of her life. In the Zarumilla neighborhood of the city of Juliaca, Virginia owns a store where she sells beverages such as beer, soft drinks, wine, and brandies from grapes (piscos), etc. that her neighbors readily buy, as Virginia is known for selling drinks of only the best and purest quality. What Virginia likes best about her job is conversing with her customers, making her long workdays more pleasant. She has had this job for four years, and the part she considers the most difficult is having to stay late into the night tending to customers who want to buy her products. With time, she would like to fix up her store's layout so as to better serve for her customers. This will be Virginia's second loan with MFP, and she is ready to work hard in order to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and is always aware of the agreements reached by the group. The 1,000 soles ($350) she's asking for will be used towards the purchase of more beverages to stock her store with and to offer a wider selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her selection of merchandise

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 33 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de locutorio, dónde realizan todo tipo de llamadas, ella a su ves vende equipos de celulares y el chip, en esta tienda también adecuó un pequeño espacio para vender los productos de herbalife, nuestra socia está metida en todo, para poder reunir dinero suficiente y construir su casita; la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio y comprar lo que le hace falta para poder hacer de su negocio un lugar acogedor y completo.

Nuestra socia  valora y agradece el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maribel is from the city of Cusco, and she is a member of the "Kantu San Jeronimo" communal bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children. Maribel divides her time between her household labors and her retail business. She has a small phone store, where she offers the opportunity to make all types of calls, and she also sells cell phones and phone cards. Inside her store, she has also set up a small space where she sells Herbalife products. She is involved in all this because she is trying to save enough money to build a small house. She needs this loan so that she can invest in her business; she will purchase the necessary supplies to make her store a well-stocked and inviting place. Maribel appreciates and values the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her multiple business activities

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestro socia  tiene 40 años de edad, ella es soltera, la socia  alterna sus  actividades rutinarias con la docencia, nuestra socia es profesora de nivel primario, ella trabaja en una escuela del distrito de san Sebastián, la socia desea el préstamo para uso personal, ella tiene unos pendientes que debe cubrir en unas semanas, lo cual no le permite tener aún su sueldo de profesora para cubrir.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Beatriz belongs to the communal bank "Kantu San Jeronimo." She is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 40 years old, single, and alternates her routine activities with teaching; she is a primary school teacher and works in a school in the San Sebastián district. She would like to have a loan for personal use; she has pending expenses that she must cover in a few weeks that her teacher's salary will not cover. She appreciates and values the loan that is being provided through these means, and is committed to pay her installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay a debt

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es:
Anabell tiene 26 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanas en la casa de sus padres. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a comercialización de cosméticos y prendas de vestir, pero desde hace 6 meses decidió que la mejor opción para generarse más ingresos es abriendo su propio salón de belleza. Por tal motivo, se asoció a su hermana para comprar todos los implementos necesarios y en la actualidad su hermana es la que  brinda la atención en lo que se refiere a tratamientos de belleza y cortes de cabello, mientras Anabell es quien administra los ingresos y egresos. Además, en su salón de belleza también venden prendas de vestir y cosméticos, de esta forma le da un valor agregado a su negocio. 

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, está muy comprometida en el bienestar de su banco comunal y lo demuestra siendo parte de la junta directiva. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de espejos y más mercadería en productos de belleza y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Anabell is 26 years old. She lives with her mother and her sisters in her parents' house. Since she was very young, she has worked selling clothing and cosmetics. However, six months ago, she decided that the best way to increase her income would be to open her own beauty salon. Accordingly, she and her sister became partners and purchased all of the necessary equipment. Her sister is currently the one who provides services such as beauty treatments and haircuts, while Anabell manages the salon's income and expenses. The sisters also sell clothing and cosmetics in their beauty salon, thus adding value to their business. This Anabell's fifth loan with MFP. She is strongly committed to the well-being of her communal bank, a fact which she has demonstrated by serving on its Board. The funds she is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of mirrors as well as additional merchandise such as beauty products and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mirrors and additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Ayde Marisol

texts.es:
La socia  Marisol; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 30 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  la docencia, ella es profesora y su pareja es obrero, nuestra socia enseña en una escuela, ella ama su trabajo y lo realiza muy bien es una profesora muy querida por todos lo alumnos, padres de familia y colegas; nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar algunas cosas para su hogar, una vez que le paguen ella cumplirá con sus pagos del préstamo.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the communal bank "Kantu San Jeronimo." She is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She alternates her activities of the home with teaching; she is a teacher and her partner is a worker. She teaches in a school, loves her work and does it very well. She is a teacher who is much loved by the students, parents and colleagues. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy some things for her house. Once she receives the loan, she will comply with the payments. She appreciates and values the loan that is provided through these means, and is committed to paying the installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy some things for the home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es:
ALCANCÍA COMUNAL "LAS GARDENIAS"

Los diez integrantes son personas emprendedoras, gracias al negocio D. éstos han logrado salir adelante pese a las inconvenientes que no falta en todo progreso, D. los ingresos D. estos trabajos buscan mejorar la calidad D. vida en sus hogares. Tales son los casos D.:
Sara, quien es presidenta del grupo decidió vender hace cuatro años cerveza en su casa, lo hizo porque llegó un tiempo que la situación se puso un poco difícil y el dinero D. su esposo no cubría todos los gastos D. la casa. Al comienzo no le gustó porque era poco lo que recibía D. ganancias; pero después esto cambió lo que le permitió incrementar su negocio en golosinas. Es así que poco tiempo pudo comprar playstation, ingresos que son utilizados en la educación a sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Necesita el crédito para invertir en cerveza que es lo que mayor venta tiene.

Silvia tiene 36 años, casada y es madre D. dos niños; lo que la motivó a trabajar fue sus hijos pues ella está empeñada a darle lo mejor a ellos.
Una amiga suya la invita a participar como ayudante para la venta D. productos D. belleza (Unique), al principio recaudaba pocos ingresos porque no era tan conocida, lo que con el tiempo esto cambió debido al carisma y buen trato que Silvia da a sus clientes, actualmente cuenta un número D. compradores. Los ingresos D. sus ventas esa para la educación y recreación a sus niños. El crédito que necesita es para la inversión D. su reciente negocio D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Community Piggy Bank "LAS GARDENIAS"

The ten members are enterprising people. Thanks to their businesses they have achieved in getting ahead in spite of the inconveniences that are evident in all progress. With the income from these jobs, they are looking to improve the quality of life of their households.

Such cases are: Sara, who is the president of the group, decided to sell beer in her house four years ago. She did it because one time a situation arrived that was a little difficult, and the money from her husband did not cover the expenses of the house. At the beginning, she didn´t like it, because she only received a little profit, but after that she changed it so that she grew her business to incluD. candies. After a little bit of time like that, she could buy a playstation. The income was used for the education of her two younger children. Se needs the loan to invest in beer because it is the best sales that she has.

Silvia is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two children. What motived her to work was her two children. She is determined to give the best to them. A friend of hers invited her to participate as a helper in the sale of beauty products (Unique). At the beginning, she collected only a little income because she wasn´t very well known, but with time this changed due to her charisma and the good treatment that Silvia gave her customers. Currently, she has a number of buyers. The income from her sales is for the education and recreation of her children. The loan that she needs is for the investment for her recent grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 34 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el trabajo de empleada doméstica, ella limpia casa y cocina para otras personas, nuestra socia realiza esta labor desde muy joven, poco a poco ha adquirido mayores beneficios dentro de su labor, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir  en algunos gastos personales.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Carmen. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu San Jeronimo” and a native of Cusco.

Carmen is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She divides her time between her household chores and her job as a domestic employee in which she cleans and cooks for other people. Carmen started working at a young age and gradually acquired more benefits as she gained experience. She is requesting a loan to pay for some personal expenses.

Carmen appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 8 años decidió abrir una empresa de servicios funerarios, donde vende ataúdes y demás artículos que se utilizan en las ceremonias de sepultura, tales como las lámparas, porta velas, letreros, entre otros. Su establecimiento está abierto en las mañanas y también por las tardes, para ello, Betty cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es el que permanece más tiempo dentro de su local, mientras Betty se encarga de sus labores domésticas, pero también está pendiente de la atención a los clientes. 

Debido a que es uno de los pocos establecimientos que brinda este servicio su negocio viene creciendo rápidamente, es por eso que Betty desea incrementar sus servicios como el alquiler de la carroza funeraria. 

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona puntual en la devolución de su préstamo, por lo que se ha tomado en cuenta para la renovación de sus créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de un juego de flores funerarias y una carroza de segundo uso para el transporte del féretro.
texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children. Eight years ago, she decided to open a funeral parlor where she sells caskets and other items used in burial ceremonies such as lamps, candle holders, placards, and other articles. Her establishment is open in the mornings as well as in the evenings. Betty has the support of her husband, who spends most of the time managing the business while she takes care of the housework. However, she is inclined to look after her customers.

Since there are few establishments in her area that offer this service, her business is growing quickly. Betty wants to expand her services by providing rental of a funeral hearse.

She will be requesting her fifth loan with MFP. Betty has been punctual with her loan repayments, which is evident in her subsequent loan approvals. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase floral arrangements and a secondhand hearse for transporting coffins.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase floral arrangements & a used hearse

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 54 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa y hace 6 meses incorporó la venta de calzado, que es lo que más ha vendido en los últimos meses. Para comprar su mercadería, mensualmente viaja a la ciudad capital (Lima), donde obtiene sus artículos al por mayor.
Dominga disfruta de su negocio, ya que esto le permite generar los ingresos económicos que necesita, además las prendas de vestir siempre tienen demanda

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos durantes sus préstamos anteriores y se compromete a seguir siéndolo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más zapatos al por mayor en su próximo viaje a Lima.
texts.en:
Dominga is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her 4 children. She has been selling clothes for 4 years, but added shoes to her inventory 6 months ago and has been selling more of them in recent months. To acquire her merchandise, Dominga travels on a monthly basis to Lima where she can purchase items in bulk. She enjoys her work and her business enables her to generate the income that she needs because clothing is always in demand.

Dominga is requesting her 5th loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with the payments from her previous loans and promises to continue in the same manner. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase shoes in larger quantities during her next trip to Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestro socio  tiene 18 años de edad, el es conviviente, el socio trabaja en un restaurante como ayudante de cocina, su pareja también es ayudante de cocina y ambos tiene  1 hijo, el socio, es un joven emprendedor y trabaja mucho para que ambos puedan casarse, educar a su hijo y comprar su casa propia, previo a su casa ellos tienen el sueño de poner su propio restaurante y ellos mismos administrarlo, nuestro joven socio solicita el préstamo para poder cubrir algunos gastos de la salud de su pequeño hijo.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a member of the Kantu San Jeronimo Communal Bank. He is a native of Cusco. Our bank member is 18 years old and is living with his girlfriend. He works in a restaurant as a kitchen helper, as does his girlfriend. The couple has one son. Juan Carlos is a young entrepreneur who works a lot so he and his girlfriend can get married, educate their son, and buy their own house. Before buying a house, the couple hopes to start their own restaurant that they themselves will run. Our young bank member is asking for a loan to cover some health expenses incurred for his young son. Juan Carlos is thankful for and values the loan that he is receiving this way and he promises to make his payments on time, within the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cover health costs incurred for his young son

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia tiene 51 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios de su zona, como quesos y truchas, los cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad de Lima.
Ella viaja todos los fines de semana llevando en sus baldes herméticos sus productos, los cuales comercializa en los principales mercados de la ciudad de manera ambulante. Trabajar de esta manera le permite a Eulogia lograr tener los ingresos económicos para su sustento, pues siempre obtiene las ganancias que ha planificado para la semana. 

Para el futuro, desea tener en su casa una tienda de abarrotes y establecerse en su localidad en venta de alimentos.

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada por el nuevo ciclo de trabajo que va a realizar con su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de más quesos.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 51 years old, living alone in her own house. For 20 years, she has sold food common to the locale, such as cheese and trout. She transports these things to sell in Lima. She works every weekend, taking her products in sealed buckets to sell in the city's major open-air markets. Working this way allows Eulogia to earn enough income to sustain herself; she always earns enough to cover her weekly budget. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store out of her home and establish herself in the local grocery market. This is the fifth loan Eulogia has received from Kiva partner MFP. She is very excited for this new opportunity to work with her communal bank. The loan she is requesting now will be used to purchase more cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Marixa Isabel

texts.es:
La socia  Isabel;  pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es albañil y tienen  4 hijos, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño puesto ambulante donde vende comidas, desde hace 5 años atrás, en la calle san isidro, la socia ayuda de esta manera al hogar y sus necesidades, ella solicita el préstamo para entre las cosas que tiene pensado comprar, ella invertirá gran parte en unas ollas y en unos cubiertos y en los insumos para los diferentes platos que realice.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank called Kantu San Jeronimo. She is a native of the city of Cusco. Isabel is 35 years old. Her husband is a brick layer and together they have 4 children. She divides her time between taking care of her home and running her small business selling snacks along San Isidro Street from her cart. She has run her business for 5 years now, and the income helps support her household needs. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies and ingredients for the different meals she prepares for her customers. Isabel appreciates the loan very much and commits to making the payments within the required time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and ingredients for her small business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La sra. Felicidad  es cliente antigua, nuy responsable, que trabaja con Emprender desD. el año 2003 empezo trabajando en grupo solidario actualmente se encuentra en la novena secuencia con credito individual; ella tiene una tienda D. barrio y tambien se dedica a la venta D. comida los fines D. semana y en los dias D. la semana a la par D. vender sus productos se dedica a tejer mantillas D. alpaca en mano D. obra por un contrato que tiene con una señora que exporta estos tejidos. Tambien por las mañanas se dedica a un trabajo D. limpieza en la zona D. chasquipampa, el esposo trabaja como contratista D. albañil ellos tienen tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el esposo anteriormente trabajaba en transporte pero dejo esa actividad vendiendo su auto para dedicarse a la construcción D. su vivienda. Como se pudo constatar la señora es una  persona muy activa, trabajando en las cuatro actividades que tiene juantamente con la colaboración D. su esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a long time client. She is very responsible, and she has worked with Emprender since 2003. She started working in supportive groups, and she is currently in her ninth individual loan cycle. She has a neighborhood store. Also, on the week ends she sells food. On the week days she sells her products as well. She hand weaves alpaca mantillas. She is under contract with a woman who exports these weavings. Also, in the mornings she has work cleaning in the Chasquipampa region. Her husband works as a contract bricklayer. They have three school aged children. Her husband previously worked in transportation, but he sold his car and left this activity in order to work on the construction of their house. It can be seen that she is a very active person. She works with the collaboration of her husband and children in the four activities that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores A. Z. reside en el municipio de Zacatecoluca en el departamento de La Paz. María vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas Jazmín de 11 años de edad y Marlene de 7 años de edad. María es una mujer muy ingenioso para hacer sus negocios, distribuye su tiempo con gran optimización para cuidar de sus familia y a su vez generar ingresos, María hace pupusas todas las mañanas después de su gran ajetreo en su negocio, sale a vender de manera ambulante a las calles y colonias cercanas donde ofrece variedad de zapatos y vitaminas, cuando empieza a ocultarse el sol María regresa a su hogar donde la espera las diversas tareas del hogar y su cría de cerdos la cual está en engorde para vender a un buen precio en temporada navideña, el crédito que solicita María es para su negocio ambulante ya que desea adquirir nueva mercadería al por mayor, donde lograr percibir un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
María Dolores A. Z. lives in the Zacatecoluca municipality in the La Paz department. María lives with her husband and her two daughters; Jazmín, 11; and Marlene, 7. María is a very ingenious woman in running her businesses. She uses her time very optimally to be able to take care of her family at the same time that she generates income. Every morning María makes “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). After this hard work for her business, she leaves to sell. She is a traveling salesperson, and she sells on the streets and in nearby districts. She sells a variety of shoes and vitamins. When it starts to get dark, María returns home where her various household chores await her. She also needs to take care of the pigs that she is fattening to sell for a good price during the Christmas season. The loan that María is asking for is for her business as a traveling salesperson. She wants to get new wholesale merchandise where she can get a greater margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen L. is from the village of P-4, Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Arlen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlen owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as bags, eyeglasses, wallets and others in the local community. Arlen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Arlen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arlen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es: Es un Cliente que se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia, el se dedica a la confección de vestidos para niñas, juntamente con su mamá quien es una artesana de 65 años y en el oficio desde hace 30 años, ella juntamente con sus hijos confeccionan ropa de niñas, vestidos blusas, camisones y todo lo que el cliente solicita, la sra. dirige el taller pese a sufrir una discapacidad en las piernas con mucho entusiasmo y energia, contratando por temporadas mano de obra en los bordados de las prendas especialmente en fin de año donde tiene mayor pedido e incluso envia al exterior sus prendas, el joven Juan Sebastian Curiti es su brazo derecho ya que el costura con agilidad las prendas en las maquinas industriales que manejan, por todo ello es rescatable el labor que realiza ya que tambien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad en sus ratos libres.
texts.en:
Juan Sebastian is in his fourth loan cycle. He works in dressmaking for young girls together with his mother, who is a 65-year-old artisan and has been in the business for the past 30 years. Along with her children, she makes clothing for young girls – dresses, shirts, nightgowns, and anything else that the customer requests. She manages the shop with much enthusiasm and energy, despite suffering from a leg impairment. She hires seasonal help for the embroidery of the garments, especially at the end of the year when she has the most requests and sends her garments abroad. Juan Sebastian Curiti is her right-hand man since he sews the garments in the industrial sewing machines with agility. The work that he does is redeeming because he also studies at the university in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Caracato Group

texts.es: El Grupo Caracato se encontraba formado por tres integrantes en el año 2005, cuando comenzaron a trabajar con la Institución, posteriormente se quedaron las dos señoras sacando el credito en garantia cruzada, siendo esta su 6ta. Secuencia en esa modalidad. La Sra. Victoria B. Tiene una Tienda de barrio en Alto Obrajes,ella quedo viuda hace dos años, tiene dos Hijas Jovenes que estudian y trabajn para costearse sus gastos de estudio, una de ellas tuvo su bebe hace un año siendo la sra. victoria quien cuida a su nieta mientras su hija trabaja y estudia, al margen de la tienda la señora elabora pan, salteñas (empanadas de carne), queques y galletas los fines de semana, y reparte a los establecimeintos educativos y kioscos de la zona es una mujer muy trabajadora. La otra integrante Sra. valentina C. tiene dos hijos jovenes que estudian en la universidad, ella trabaja mas de 20 años como enpleada domestica en la zona de Obrajes donde vive con sus hijos, ella no tiene esposo ya que hace muchos años se separo del padre de sus hijos; la actividad principal es la de venta de comida, actividad que realiza los fines de semana, donde tambien tiene la colaboracion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Caracato Group was formed by three members in 2005 when they began working with Emprender (Kiva Field Partner). Subsequently, two women remain in the communal bank and this is their sixth loan. Mrs. Victoria B. has a neighborhood store in Alto Obrajes. She became a widow two years ago and has two daughters that study and work to pay for their tuition. One of them had a baby last year and Mrs. Victoria takes care of her granddaughter while her daughter works and studies. Apart from the store, Victoria also makes bread, salteñas (meat empanadas), cakes, and cookies on the weekends and delivers them to schools and nearby kiosks. Victoria is a very hard working woman.

The other member is Mrs. Valentina C.. She has two children that are in college. Valentina has worked for more than 20 years as a domestic worker in the Obrajes area where she lives with her children. She is not married and has been separated from the father of her children for many years. She sells food on the weekends with the help of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 31 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Leilita

texts.en:
Leilita E. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City. She is 35 years old. Leilita is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leilita owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of products in the local community. Leilita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leilita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma H. is from the village of Sinayawan, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Emma is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is single. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a direct sales business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beauty products from Avon and others in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo M. is from the village of Danao. He is 54 years old. Rodulfo is married. To make a living, Rodulfo owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rodulfo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rodulfo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodulfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

Rodulfo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rodulfo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Dioso

texts.en:
Dioso B. is from the village of Danao. He is 48 years old. Dioso is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Dioso owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Dioso has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dioso joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioso has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Dioso is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Dioso from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is 30 years old and living a simple life with her family in Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, which is a rural area. She is married to Mr. Daniel M., who works as a farmer. They have been married for almost five years and are blessed with two healthy children: Jordan, a 4-year-old preschooler, and Junella Joy, who is only 1 year old.

Mila has been a fruits and vegetable vendor for almost four months. She sells bananas and some root crops in their village, where she earns a weekly net income of 600 Philippine pesos. With her desire to have additional capital for her vending business to provide for her family's needs, she applied for a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos from ASKI through Kiva lenders. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan immediately for her to maintain the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for fruits and vegetables vending

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es: Flavio G. C. de 41 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos aun menores de edad. Flavio y su esposa trabajan juntos en su pequeño negocio, una tienda con productos de consumo diario, la cual se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, los ingresos generados por el negocio son excelentes pero Flavio y su esposa se lamentan de falta de productos que carece su negocio y que muchos clientes buscan, ellos desean de un crédito que les permita surtir su negocio con otros productos como granos básicos y variedad de bebidas , para poder  aprovechar al máximo la demanda de sus clientes, Flavio es una persona muy responsable con sus créditos otorgados, actualmente no posee ningún crédito activo.
texts.en:
Flavio G. C. is 41-years-old and lives in the department of La Libertad along with his wife and their two young children. Flavio and his wife have a small business together, a convenience store which is located in their home. Their business brings in a high income, but his wife regrets that their business lacks products that many customers want. They want a loan so they can supply their business with other products such as basic grains and a variety of drinks to be able to get the most from their customer demand. Flavio is a very responsible person with his loans and none of them are currently outstanding.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supply business with products such as grains and drinks

loans.name: Batyi's Group

texts.en:
Batyi is the leader of this group. Her husband is engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture. For the age of fifty four, Batyi has achieved a lot. She and her husband have raised seven children, all of whom are now adults and have their own families, except for their youngest son, who is just seven years old. Her daughter, age 36 and single, is temporarily unemployed. Her oldest son, age 35, is married and works as a car mechanic. Their second son, age 34, is married and works as a driver. Their third son is also married and works as a taxi-driver. Next is another son who works in a factory. The fifth son is 21 years old and works at a construction site. Their youngest son goes to school.

Despite having this army of sons as her supporters, Batyi has been fully independent in managing her own business. She sells sheep. It has been her main source of income for six years. By doing this, she has been able to buy a flat for one of her sons and help him get married. Her income is now around $230, even though she started with a third as much money. She obtains her children’s help when needed. It does not undermine the courage and determination that she possesses.

Now Batyi is preparing a dowry for her daughter, whom she wants to marry off next year. So she has thought about obtaining a loan to by cattle to increase the turnover and prepare a rich dowry for her daughter.

Batyi’s partners are: Kyial, Nazgul and Zarylbubu. Kyial, age 32, is the mother of three children. She sells “bozo” and “maxym,” which are national drinks. Her husband is a taxi driver. Kyial needs a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare the national drinks.

Zarylbubul, age 46, is a widow and the mother of four children. Fortunately, most of them are adust. To make a living, Zarylbubu works as a cashier. Nazgul needs a loan to buy a dowry for her daughter.

Nazgul, age 27, has two children. She works in an ice cream shop. She needs a loan to buy furniture.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.name: Jurai

texts.en:
Jurai U. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She lives with her family in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student and her two younger daughters attend a local secondary school. Her husband, Erdenebileg, is a construction worker. 

U. rents and operates a well, providing water to many households in her area. She also sells coal and firewood to supplement  her earnings. U. started renting the well in 1987 and has operated a successful business for many years. All of her customers are very thankful for all of the services she provides, and U. works very hard to make sure they always have plenty of water and firewood. U.'s business is very important to her and she always works hard to improve her family's quality of life. She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) loan to purchase more coal and firewood to sell.
