loans.name: Altyngul's Group

texts.ru:
Алтынгуль – лидер этой группы. Ей сорок три года. К этому возрасту  Алтынгуль вырастила троих детей. Старшему семнадцать, среднему пятнадцать и младшей дочке десять. Все они сейчас ходят в школу. Муж Алтынгуль – врач-реаниматолог. Сама же она занимается розничной торговлей пледов, одеял, и постельных комплектов. До того, как заняться предпринимательской деятельностью, у Алтынгуль уже был опыт в торговле, в качестве продавщицы. Семь лет назад, набравшись опыту и мужества, она всё-таки рискнула вложить все свои накопления в размере шестидесяти тысяч сом (KGS) на закупку товара. За это время её деятельность позволила ей обновить мебель в доме, купить бытовую технику и увеличить поголовье скота. Сейчас Алтынгуль зарабатывает около двенадцати тысяч сом в месяц. Алтынгуль прочно встала на ноги, и намеревается дальше развивать свой бизнес. Сейчас Алтынгуль нуждается в кредите, который бы ей позволил закупить новую партию постельного белья. Она хочет купить постельные комплекты нового ассортимента, так как это увеличило бы товарооборот и привлекло большее количество покупателей. По словам Алтынгуль, всё это она делает ради того, чтобы дать высшее образование дочери. Она мечтает о том, чтобы открыть второе место бизнеса и расширить бизнес. 

У Алтынгуль есть партнёры по группе:

Мээрим двадцать три. Она замужем и у неё один ребёнок.  Ему всего два года и девять месяцев. Муж работает внештатным работником ГАИ. Мээрим же работает в сетевом маркетинге. Она продаёт косметику от фирмы «Мэри Кэй».  Вначале она сама пользовалась косметикой этой фирмы, а впоследствии начала непосредственно сотрудничать с ними. Мээрим обратилась за кредитом с целью закупки нескольких видов теней, помад и духов.

Джумагуль пятьдесят три года. Она вдова и мать двоих детей. Младший сын находится на заработках в России, а старший живёт с ней и помогает в бизнесе. На жизнь, Джумагуль зарабатывает за счёт торговли продуктами питания. Она занимается этим уже десять лет и её месячный доход составляет около шестнадцати тысяч сомов. Джумагуль нужен кредит для того, чтобы закупить новую партию продуктов питания.

Венере сорок лет. Она замужем и у неё одна дочь. Дочке двадцать лет и она живёт отдельно от родителей. Венера уже на пенсии и подрабатывает гувернанткой. Так как отопительный сезон вот-вот начнётся, Венера решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить на зиму угля. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Altyngul is the leader of this group. She is forty-three years old. By this age, Altyngul raised three children. Her oldest is seventeen, middle is fifteen and the youngest daughter is ten. All of them currently attend school. Altyngul’s husband is a critical-care physician. Altyngul is involved in retail sales of blankets, bed covers and bedding sets. Prior to starting her entrepreneurship, Altyngul already had experience in retail as a salesperson. Seven years ago, having gained experience and bravery, she decided to risk all of her savings in the sum of sixty thousand som (KGS) in order to purchase merchandise. Since that time, her business allowed her to update furniture at home, buy household appliances and increase livestock headcount. Now Altyngul earns approximately twelve thousand som per month. Altyngul solidly stands on her feet and intends to continue developing her business further. Currently, Altyngul needs a loan, which would enable her to purchase a new stock of bedding. She wants to buy a new selection of bedding sets because it will help increase goods turnover and attract a larger quantity of customers. According to Altyngul, she is doing all this in order to provide her daughter with higher education. She dreams of opening another business location and grow her business.

Altyngul has partners in this group:

Meerim is twenty-three years old. She is married and has one child, who is only two years and nine months old. Her husband works as a civilian police employee. Meerim works in network marketing. She sells cosmetics from Mary Kay. At first, she used to use Mary Kay cosmetics herself and then started to work with them directly. Meerim requested a loan in order to purchase several types of eye shadow, lipstick and perfume. Djumagul is fifty-three years old. She is a widow and a mother of two children. Her youngest son is working in Russia, and the oldest lives with her and helps with the business. Djumagul makes a living from sales of food products. She has been involved in this for ten years already, and her monthly income consists of approximately sixteen thousand som. Djumagul needs a loan in order to purchase a new stock of food products.

Venera is forty years old. She is married and has one daughter. Her daughter is twenty years old and lives separately from her parents. Venera is already retired and works part-time as a governess. Because the heating season is starting very soon, Venera decided to request a loan in order to purchase coal for the winter. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of new bedding assortment to expand selection and attract more customers

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en:
A. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 14 year old daughter in the Tuv province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," which is a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local high school while A. and her husband operate the family business. 

They own a small car repair business that they started in 2004. At first, the couple rented a small tire repair shop, but after a year of successful business operation, they managed to buy the shop and expand their services. They now sell parts, oil, tires and wheel components. A. hopes to move out of their ger into their own apartment some day where the family can be more comfortable. She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to build a fence around the car repair shop and to purchase more oil, tires and parts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more oil, tires and parts to sell

loans.name: 02.03.1.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mai H. Thị (16) is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the town of T. Hoá . Mai is the leader of a seven-member group loan sponsored by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.1.4 (02.03.1.4 Nam Ngạn).

Mai is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Mai sells rice products in the local community. Mai has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mai joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Mai's third loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


N. Thị Phương (18) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
T. Thị Nguyệt (19) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.
N. Thị Dậu (20) is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
Ngô T. Thuỷ (21) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.
P. Thị Kim (22) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.
N. Thị Thuỷ  (17) is a 48 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.



Mai H. Thị (16) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoá . Mai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.1.4 (02.03.1.4 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2008, Mai đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Mai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. N. Thị Phương (18) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2. T. Thị Nguyệt (19) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3. N. Thị Dậu (20) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4. Ngô T. Thuỷ (21) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5. P. Thị Kim (22) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


6. N. Thị Thuỷ  (17) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Quirwin

texts.en:
Quirwin E. is from the village of Lacapp, Acad Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. He is 37 years old, married, and has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Quirwin owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, he buys and sells "uling" charcoal to local community members. Quirwin has been engaged in this business for over 3 years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Quirwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve his living situation as well as his ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Quirwin has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Quirwin is now requesting a second loan from GDMPC in the amount of 6,000 PHP ($150), which will be used to expand the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his charcoal sales business

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza A. is a 55-year-old married woman from the village of P-3, Sabacan, Panadtalan. She has 4 adult-age children. To earn a living, Feliza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where her income is largely generated from sales of food and daily living products to her local community members. Feliza has been engaged in this business for over 8 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2008, Feliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and to thereby help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Feliza has already successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI in the amount of 5,000 PHP. Feliza is now requesting a second loan from HSPFI in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to expand her inventory (by purchasing new items). She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to expand and improve her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and was established to serve the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing new products

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.en:
Uldarico J. T. is a 45-year-old married man from the village of Bliss, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, in the Philippines. He has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Uldarico owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. Specifically, he runs a "carenderia" -- i.e., a mini restaurant. At the carenderia, his income is primarily derived from serving a variety of different meals to customers from his local community. Uldarico has been engaged in this business for over 2 years, and he earns approximately 5,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Uldarico joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby help improve his living situation as well as his ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Uldarico has already successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC in the amount of 20,000 PHP, which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Uldarico is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP ($450), which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the mini restaurant. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Uldarico from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to improve and expand his business and to pay for his children's school tuition.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly comprised of farmers, fishermen, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for his restaurant

loans.name: Sambuu

texts.en: Sambuu B. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter currently works as a librarian, her youngest daughter is a university student and her youngest son is in kindergarten. B. operates a vegetable selling business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD), and has since built a stable operation. She has found success in her trade and attributes it to the good reputation she has built with her many customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). For the future, B. hopes for continued business success and says, "I would like to expand my business and hope to one day own my own workspace." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dashjamts

texts.en: T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children, ages 20, 19 and 5, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her 19 year old daughter attends university and her youngest child is in kindergarten. T. and her husband work together in their retail clothing business. They began this business in 2004 with working capital of 350,000 tugrug (~240 USD), and after several years of hard work, their working capital now exceeds 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1750 USD). T. wants to expand the business even further by introducing new product lines from China. With these new product lines, she hopes to grow the customer base even further. T. is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan so that she can begin to import these new product lines from China.

loans.use: To import new product lines from China

loans.name: Burulcha's Group

texts.ru:
Лидер этой группы – Бурулча. Ей пятьдесят четыре года и она разведена. Бурулча вырастила троих детей. Сейчас старшей дочери двадцать семь лет. Она работает заграницей в г. Дубаи. Среднему сыну двадцать пять. Он работает в Кыргызстане и живёт отдельно. Младшая, двадцати одна летняя дочь, живёт со старшей сестрой в г. Дубаи. Бурулча, несмотря на свой преклонный возраст, активно занимается увеличением поголовья скота, тем самым сама обеспечивает себя всем необходимым. Два года назад дочь отправила деньги в размере шести тысяч сомов и Бурулча смогла закупить скотину. Разведение скота пришлось ей по душе и Бурулча целиком втянулось в это предприятие. Со временем ей удалось увеличить поголовье скота, продав который, она тут же решила подарить сыну машину. На данный момент, она для своих домашних нужд держит корову и бычка, и так же занимается увеличение поголовья крупно – рогатого скота. Бурулча видит огромный спектр возможностей в этом бизнесе, так как сама природа Кыргызстана очень хорошо приспособлена к разведению скота. Именно по этой самой причине и решила Бурулча обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить бычков и отправить их в деревню, где живёт её мать. Откарливая скот там полгода, Бурулча хотела бы продать весь купленный скот и купить мягкую мебель для дома. В планы Бурулчи также входит разнообразить поле деятельности и открыть в будущем вулканизацию, где будет работать её сын. В будущем, Бурулча также хочет построить большой дом для себя и сына. Ради этого она готова пожертвовать временем и усилием. 

Вместе с Бурулчой в группу также входят: Гулия, Гульнара и Мыскал. 

Гулие пятьдесят семь. Вместе с супругом они пенсионеры. Дети давно выросли и живут отдельно. Гулия вместе с мужем держат коров и четыре года занимаются мелким скотоводством. Они успели увеличить поголовье скота и построить дом. Гулие нужен кредит, чтобы закупить еще скотины для увеличения поголовья. 

Гульнаре мать пятерых детей. Муж Гульнары строитель. Гульнара занимается животноводством. Муж Гульнары обеспечил её изначальным капиталом и всячески помогал жене в её новом деле. Гульнара рада своему делу и обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить корову и затем продавать молоко.

Мыскал сорок пять. Она вдова и мать троих детей. Мыскал живёт за счёт животноводства. Заниматься этим делом Мыскал решила сама. Из детей ей никто не помогает. Мыскал решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить бычка, откормить его и затем продать. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burulcha is the leader of this group. She is fifty-four years old and divorced. Burulcha raised three children. Right now, her oldest daughter is twenty-seven years old. She works overseas in Dubai. The middle son is twenty-five. He works in Kyrgyzstan and lives separately. The youngest, twenty-one-year-old daughter lives with the older sister in Dubai. Despite her age, Burulcha is actively involved in increasing livestock headcount, and thus can provide herself with all the necessities. Two years ago, her daughter sent her money in the sum of six thousand som, and Burulcha was able to purchase livestock. She liked breeding livestock so much that she fully devoted herself to this entrepreneurship. With time, Burulcha could increase livestock headcount, having sold which, she decided to give her son a car right away. Currently, she keeps a cow and a bull for her domestic needs and is also involved in increasing headcount of cattle. Burulcha sees a wide spectrum of opportunities in this business because the environment in Kyrgyzstan is very conducive to breeding livestock. This is precisely the reason why Burulcha decided to request a loan in order to purchase bulls and send them to a village, where her mother lives. After raising livestock there for half a year, Burulcha would want to sell all of the purchased livestock and buy soft furniture for home. Burulcha’s plans also include varying her entrepreneurial activity and opening a tire vulcanization shop, where her son would work. In the future, Burulcha also wants to build a big house for herself and her son. For this, she is ready to sacrifice her time and effort.

Along with Burulcha, this group includes Guliya, Gulnara and Myskal. Guliya is fifty-seven. Her husband and she are retired. Their children are grown and live separately. Together with her husband, Guliya keep cows and have been involved in small-scale pastoral farming. They were able to increase livestock headcount and build a house. Guliya needs a loan in order to buy more livestock to increase headcount.

Gulnara is a mother of five children. Her husband is a construction worker. Gulnara is involved in animal husbandry. Her husband provided Gulnara with the starting capital and helped her in other ways in her new business. Gulnara is happy with her business and requested a loan in order to purchase a cow and then sell milk.

Myskal is forty-five. She is a widow and a mother of three children. Myskal makes a living from animal husbandry. She decided to get involved in this business on her own. None of her children help her with the business. Myskal decided to request a loan in order to purchase a bull, raise it and then sell it. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulls for raising and future resale at a market, which would allow a purchase of soft furniture for home

loans.name: Tsagaan

texts.en: D. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and the youngest of three children in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two oldest children attend university away from home and his 15 year old daughter attends a local high school. D. and his wife operate a retail flour business in their town. They began the business six months ago and since then have been earning enough money to greatly improve their quality of life. D. and his wife travel to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase flour in bulk, then travel back to their province and sell the flour for a profit. He would eventually like to have his own local flour market in the province so that he and his wife could sell a larger amount of it. D. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to help him purchase a large amount of flour from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of flour from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: 02.1.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Chính N. Thị (33) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Chính is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.02.1.6).

Chính is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Chính owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Chính has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Chính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chính has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to further invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chính plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. B. Thị Hài (28) is a 63 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

2. N. Thị Hiền (29) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

3. Đỗ Thị T. Hương (30) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

4. Vũ Thị Vân (31) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

5. P. Thị Nga (32) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

6. H. Thị Lâm (34) is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Chính N. Thị (33) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Chính là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.02.1.6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Chính thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Chính kiếm được khoảng 1.800.000 VND. Vào 2008, Chính đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Chính đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. B. Thị Hài (28) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2. N. Thị Hiền (29) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

3. Đỗ Thị T. Hương (30) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

4. Vũ Thị Vân (31) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

5. P. Thị Nga (32) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

6. H. Thị Lâm (34) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and is married to Gilbert who manages their knives manufacturing business. They have been blessed with three children; the eldest is now in grade five, the second is in grade two, and the other two are not yet studying. They live in the village of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City, where most of the residents are engaged in the blacksmith manufacturing business or simply making knives. Aside from that, she also accepts laundry services to have an extra source of income. Through this, she earns an income of PHP 1,250 weekly.

Josephine is doing her best to become successful in the business so that she can able to send her children to school, but she lacks capital to run it. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders as additional working capital for their business. She hopes that the loan will be granted so she can use it for the expansion of their business.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Pineda

texts.en:
Pineda said she believes that "patience is a virtue". She manages a livestock business, particularly focussed on hog-raising, and her net income is PHP2,000.00 every 3 months. She is now planning to expand her hog-raising business by having an additional pigpen for their shelter. For this, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 that she can use to pursue her plan and also to buy two bags of hog feed.

She is married to Victoriano, a farmer, and they are blessed with six children, four of whom are already married. They live with their two single children in the village of San Pablo, Alicia, a rural area where most of the people are engaged in farming. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Addtional capital in her hog-raising business

loans.name: Ulziit

texts.en: D. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. Her son and daughter both attend a local secondary school and her husband is a taxi driver in their town. D. operates a retail cosmetic business and beauty salon in a rented space. Her business started in 2000 and has grown steadily over the years due to her loyal customers. Twice a month, D. transports beauty products from Mongolia’s capital city, Ulaanbaatar, back to her business. She wants her children to be able to continue their education at university so that they can contribute to their country’s development. D. is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~2800 USD) loan in order to purchase more beauty products and tools for her growing salon.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and tools for her growing salon

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie D. is from the village of Pwerta, Lurugan Valencia City. She is 33 years old. Margie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products such as bags and some clothing wear in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Margie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olufta

texts.ru: Юсупова Олуфта проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 41 год. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. По специальности Олуфта, "технолог", но она более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует детскими вещами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Olufta Y. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 41 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Olufta is a technologist by trade, but she has been involved in retail sales for over 12 years. She has a retail outlet at a market, where she sells children's merchandise. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 69 years old, widowed and has five adult children. She is from the village of Pwerta, Lurugan, Valencia City. Norma has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 pesos from HSPFI. Norma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chimedhorloo

texts.en:
E. is 53 years old and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the large city. His daughter attends university and his wife sells accessories like gloves and glasses in the Narantuul market, the largest and busiest markets in the city.

E. operates a microbus transportation service and takes passengers from one side of Ulaanbaatar to the other. He began his business in 2000 by renting his friend's microbus and, after several years of hard work and saving, he managed to buy his own vehicle. He says, “I work hard every day to improve my business in order to improve my family’s quality of life.” E. is requesting a 2,300,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase repair parts for his microbus.

loans.use: To purchase repair parts for his microbus

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 28 years old. Jerlyn is married and has two young children. To make a living, Jerlyn operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jerlyn has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jerlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jerlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jerlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gardimo

texts.ru: Гардимо Шарипова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 33 года. Свободна, детей не имеет. Гардимо более 6 лет проработала по специальности "учителем". В данный момент она более 2 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует национальными материалами. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Gardimo S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 33 years old, single and has no children. Gardimo had worked as a teacher for over 6 years. Currently, she has been involved in retail sales for over 2 years. She has a retail outlet at a market, where she sells traditional fabrics. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of new merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise selection

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en:
Gulzada is the leader of this group. She is twenty five and has one child. Her married life has ended as soon as it started. Now Gulzada is divorced and has to raise her child herself. Gulzada is not the kind of person to whine and snivel. Instead she just has turned another page of her life is full of energy to keep going. At least Gulzada’s aunt has been helping her for the time being to look after the child. For living Gulzada sews national clothing. Gulzada got involved in sewing due to her aunt, who saw her skill and found the best way to use it. Gulzada’s aunt provided her with the initial capital to start up. She gave her 350$ so that Gulzada was able to purchase all the necessary materials and fabric. During past three years Gulzada has got new customers and increased her turnover. Currently her monthly income constitutes 280$. It is almost 80% of the initial aunt’s capital. Gulzada has become a lot more experienced and learned how to make many kinds of national clothing for sale. She now wants to get a loan to purchase materials for sewing new kinds of national clothing and thus be able to attract more customers and finally increase her sales. On profit gained, she plans to buy a sewing machine and overstitching machine to increase her efficiency and produce more qualitative clothing. Gulzada’s ultimate dream is to have her own flat. These are Gulzada’s partners: Aisalkyn, Elmira and Iskenderbek. Aisalkyn is divorced. She has no children. Currently she is engaged in commerce at a local market. A sister of hers helped her to set up in business. Now Aisalkyn manages everything herself. Aisalkyn has applied for this loan to purchase new goods. Elmira, 38, has three children. Her husband is a builder. She works in a bakery and sells national bread. Elmira’s monthly income is 140$. Elmira needs this loan to invest it in buying ingredients (wheat flour, yeast, etc). Elmira wants expand her business and start saving money to buy a big house. Iskenderbek, 34, has three children. Iskenderbek earns his family’s living by working in a building company. He transports building materials on his own car. His wife works as a charwoman. Iskenderbek has applied for this loan to invest it in buying auto spares for his car. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing new kinds of national clothing and thus be able to attract more customers and finally increase sales

loans.name: Lhagviilha

texts.en:
Lhagviilha G. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. His wife is currently unemployed and looks after their son when he isn't at kindergarten.

G. operates a hair salon out of a rented apartment in his town. He started his salon in 2008 with capital of 80,000 tugrugs (~56 USD) and has progressed his business in a short time. Today, he is well established in the local business community and his working capital exceeds 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD).

For the future, G. hopes to have his own building for his salon and dreams of becoming the best hairdresser in town. G. works very hard and uses his earnings to support his family and improve their quality of life. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase more tools and hair products for his salon.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and hair products for his salon

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel L. is 41 years old and lives with her two daughters in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her oldest daughter currently attends university and her youngest is in high school.

L. operates a small cafe in her town. Her cafe specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian meals and is a popular dining establishment in her community. L. started her cafe in 2000 and has built a successful business over the years. She continues to build on her business experience and always tries to attract new customers.

L.'s business is very important to her and her family and she works very hard to improve her children's quality of life. She hopes to continue to provide for their education and help them become responsible people. For the future, she hopes to continue to expand her business and customer base. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase food supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is from the village of Militar,Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Lorna is married and has 3 school aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating pedicab transport services. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay for the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her pedicab transport service

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
Teresita has been selling fruits and snacks on the school campus for almost 15 years. She is 34 years old and has been separated from her husband for almost a year. She has three children, namely: Michelle, 18 years of age, third year college student; followed by Riza Joy, 14 years old, second year high school; and their youngest is Randy, 9 years of age, Grade V pupil. She is living peacefully in barangay San Francisco, Alicia, Isabela, with her son. Her two daughters are living with their grandmother in Nueva Ecija, Philippines.

Teresita's net income for five days is 400 pesos. Wanting to increase her income for the education of her children, she would like to borrow 5,000 pesos from ASKI for additional capital and to purchase some grocery items for her retail store. She hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted as soon as possible to financially support her business and her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Junai

texts.en:
Junai N. operates a used clothing business in her town. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a small house. Of her three children that are still of school age, one son attends university and her youngest son and daughter are still in high school. Her husband works as a security guard at a local consumer goods store.

N. sells a variety of secondhand clothing items for both children and adults. She started her clothing business in 2007 with capital of 650,000 tugrugs (~460 USD) after previously working as a salesperson. She has quickly been able to build a stable business and has continued to improve her selling skills. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,300,000 tugrugs (~914 USD). N. is very hardworking and hopes her future business success will enable her to support her children's education. She is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug (~770 USD) loan to purchase blankets, rags, children's clothing, and pants to sell at her business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, rags, children's clothing and pants to sell

loans.name: Lê Thị Hồng

texts.en:
P. Lê Thị Hồng is starting a business venture providing recycling services. The main source of income comes from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. P. is a 20-year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. She is married and does not have any children. P. has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 2.500.000 đồng a month from these activities.

In 2007, P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.142.000 đồng from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. P. is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 đồng which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. P. plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. No. 10102140026.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

P. Lê Thị Hồng (10102140026) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và không có con. Để kiếm sống, P. Đang bắt đầu công việc kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chuyên chở phế liệu cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa P.. P. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. P. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. P. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.ru: Тагоева Чинигул проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 58 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Чинигул имеет среднее образование. Чинигул более 8 лет занимается продажей у себя дома. Она готовит салаты из овощей, а потом продает их как оптом так и в розницу. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, чтобы загатовить новую партию салатов. Ей в этом также помогают ее дети.
texts.en:
Chinigul T. lives in the city of Kulyab. She is a 58-year-old widow with five children. Chinigul completed secondary education. For more than eight years, Chinigul has been involved in sales out of her home. She prepares salads from vegetables, and then sells them both wholesale and retail. The loan is requested for the purchase of ingredients, in order to prepare a new batch of salads. In this way, she helps her children.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to produce salads

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg T. operates a silver goods and craft business out of a rented stall in a large store in the city. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house. Her husband currently works as a decorator, her oldest daughters attend the local secondary school, and the youngest two haven't yet reached school age.

T. started her business in 2004 after previously working as a salesperson for two years. Her business has been quite successful and her earnings have allowed her to build a house for her family and extend their yard. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). She continues to work hard to grow her business and expand her customer base. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase more silver products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more silver products

loans.name: Sulaimoni

texts.ru: Сулаймони Рахматулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 21 год. Холост. Сулаймони более 4 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. Ему в этом также помогает его отец. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота. На полученную прибыль хочет сыграть свадьбу.
texts.en:
Sulaimoni R. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 21 years old. Sulaimoni has been doing animal husbandry for more than four years, he feeds and sells cattle. His father is also helping him with it. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle. He wants to use the profit to have a wedding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hànội. She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, T. raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables. T. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

In 2004, T. joined SEDA in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.142.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. T. is now requesting a new loan of 4.142.000 VND, which will also be used to expand the business. The loan will be her 8th loan from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA: 

SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) provides microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Hoàng Thị (10102110021) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, T. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch rau quả để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2004, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: expanding her business

loans.name: Aqlema Group

texts.en:
Aqlema and Fajya want to take out a loan for their tailoring business. They would like to buy new sewing machines. Jamela is requesting a loan for a quilting business. Nahida wants to receive a loan for her brother’s car parts shop. Khatera wants to take out a loan for her husband who is a mechanic and wants to buy essential materials for his shop. Nabila wants to take out a loan her husband who has a taxi and wants to buy a new part for it.

This is the Aqlema Group and Jamela is the group leader. The six members of this group have requested a group loan of 60,000 afghanis.

loans.use: To expand a quilting business

loans.name: Bryant

texts.en:
Bryant M. is from the village of Lumbayao, Valencia City. He is 33 years old. Bryant is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Bryant raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Bryant has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Bryant joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bryant has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Bryant is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Bryant from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding the business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio C. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City. He is 46 years old. Antonio is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Antonio makes and sells food. The main source of income for this business comes from making and selling ice cream in the local community. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Antonio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help him improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Antonio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel D. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Jocel is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Jocel raises crops. The main source of income for this business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocel joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Baby Khode Group

texts.en:
Nabela, Pari Gul and Zakia want to receive loans for tailoring. Pashton wants to take out a loan for cleaning vegetables. She buys vegetables and cleans them so that her husband can sell them in the market at a higher price.

Nabela is the leader of Baby Khode Group. The four members of this group plan to buy essential materials and expand their businesses. They would like to take out a group loan of 40,000 afghanis. They are all happy with the loan process.

loans.use: To purchase business requirements

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Febelyn is a young mother who lives in a village located at Barangay Pieza, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 21 years old. Because of her early marriage, she only completed a secondary level of education. She is married to Jeffrey V.; they are blessed with a child named Eunice V.. It is difficult for them to earn a living because they have no stable job. 
	
Her husband cultivates their parcel of land by planting rice and some vegetables while Febelyn uses their tricycle to earn income. Through her patience and sacrifices, she earns a minimum income of PHP 200 per day. She utilizes this to acquire their daily basic needs and to save for the future of their child. Due to the high cost of commodities, she needs to earn more income to meet their daily needs. Consequently, she wants to borrow additional capital from ASKI, amounting to PHP 7,000. It will be used for the maintenance of their tricycle. She is very grateful for this financial assistance because it will allow her to use her tricycle continuously and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: maintaining her tricycle

loans.name: Leodiza

texts.en:
Leodiza B. is from the town of Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Leodiza is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Leodiza owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Leodiza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leodiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leodiza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Leodiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Matildah Nambalirwa's Group

texts.en:
Matildah is 33 and married with four children between the ages of 8 and 16.  All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house, where she is staying with six people. Matildah takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Matildah sells charcoal in Namungoona. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and also with MCDT for six years, servicing her 12th loan. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Matildah sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She buys her charcoal from the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from her source. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works from an open place. 

Matildah wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Selling vegetables and raising goats is the business of Nora C.. She is 39 years old and a business-minded person. She is happily engaged to Prudencio, who is a farmer in their village. The couple are blessed with four children : Matcris, 20 years old, a college student; Julie, 16 years old; Robert, 14 years old, high school student; and the youngest is Fernan, 7 years old, elementary pupil.

Nora would like to improve their way of living and needs to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Due to the large size of her household, her income doesn’t go far enough to meet all their needs. That’s why she is asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders, so that she can buy vegetables and generate more capital for her children's needs. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 pesos.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion K. is from the village of Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Salvacion is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Salvacion owns & operates a retail store selling vegetables in the local community. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salvacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salvacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the village of Purok 21, Valencia City. She is 45 years old. Lolita is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a retail store selling vegetables and spices in the local market. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 47 years old and married to Rick S.. They have three loving children: Erickson, 19 years old, who is a fourth year college student; Ronel, 17 years old, who is a high school graduate but stopped due to lack of financial resources because their eldest is still studying; and Jerick, 8 years old, who is a  grade IV pupil. Emelita and Rick are thankful because the children understand their family situation.

	Emelita is a storeowner, vegetable vendor and a tricycle operator within the village of Dibul Saguday, Quirino. She has been managing her store for almost two years now. Every Wednesday, Friday and Sunday she sells her merchandise at Gundaway Quirino. She sells vegetables and ingredients to have an additional source of income for her students. Her husband is a tricycle driver within their village. She is hoping that she can supply her children needs. Emelita would like to improve the business by asking for additional capital from the KIVA lenders. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes that she can receive the loan amount that she is requesting. She wants to buy more items to sell to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Fredielyn

texts.en:
Fredielyn B. is from the village of Purok 4, Valencia City. She is 25 years old. Fredielyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Fredielyn owns & operates a business providing internet services to local community members. Fredielyn has been engaged in her internet cafe business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fredielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
