loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two grown sons. She runs a successful small business selling women’s clothing in the central city market of Melitopol. Her profit is 3,000 Ukrainian grivnas per month.

Olga has been in this business for more than 10 years. She is very serious and determined about her business. Besides that, the ability to give her customers what they want plus a little more, such as a smile or a word of encouragement, has helped Olga keep loyal customers who come back over and over again. 

Olga is requesting a loan for 8,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She will use the additional income to help her children's families improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky D. is engaged in fruit and vegetable vending. She sells her products in the village of Dibul Saguday, Quirino. She is married to Roger D. who is into rice farming. Roger is really working hard in their field because, aside from the vending business, farming is their other source of income. The couple hopes that they can have a progressive life thus, they are striving hard for the welfare of their children.
	
Vicky has managed her business for so many years but still she needs to improve it and buy additional vegetables so that she can generate more income for the needs of her children. She said that sending their children to school is costly because of the tuition fees, daily allowance and projects.

Vicky and Roger are blessed with three children: Airene, 19 years old, who stopped her schooling because of financial insufficiency; Regie, 17 years old, who is a third-year high school student; and May Cy, 13 years old, who is a first year high school student. Her husband is in full support of her business. With her desire to give her family a better living, she decided to borrow a loan from ASKI of PHP 5000, which she will use to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Assa

texts.en: Assa is 42 years old and married with three children between the ages of 15 and 19 years.  All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a six-room house where she stays with 10 people. Assa takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  She has a stall selling crafts like mats, table cloths and bowls.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for 10 years, servicing her 20th loan.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Assa sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. She buys her crafts from women in Bombo (Nubian) who mostly work in crafts towns in Uganda and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works from an open place. Assa wants to use this loan to buy more crafts. She hopes to see her business grow stronger and to start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crafts for resale

loans.name: Shonhor

texts.en: E. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. Her daughter and son both attend a local high school while E. and her husband operate a shoe business. She began her business in 1994 after purchasing a sewing machine from her former employer. Today, she makes between 30 and 100 pairs of shoes per month, depending on the season. E.’s working capital is now between 2,000,000 and 3,000,000 tugrugs per month with a net profit between 400,000 and 500,000 tugrugs per month. She attributes her business success to both her excellent sewing and accounting skills. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue for her business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue for her business

loans.name: Komuna

texts.en:
D. Komuna is 40 years old and married with two children. Her business involves purchasing and reselling cows with her husband. She has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni in order to purchase additional cows to meet customer demand. Komuna believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and further increase their income to aid her children's education. You could become an important part in the life of Komuna and her family. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

The couple is happily residing together with their granddaughter in San Pablo Alicia, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near a rice farm and irrigation area.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat has worked as a seamstress for seven years. She worked with her mother, which is how she learned her trade. Nazokat specializes in national women's dresses. Her workshop is located near her house, and she works Monday through Sunday from 8 am until 5 pm. She would like to take out a loan of 4500 TJS in order to purchase new, modern fabrics for her business. Nazokat is counting on your help and thanks all of you.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing dresses

loans.name: Naqeeb Group

texts.en:
Naqeeb is the group leader of the three-member Naqeeb group. Each member wants to take a loan for expanding their business.

Naqeeb wants to take a loan for his building supplies business.

Salia wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a general store.

Bulqes wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

They are requesting a group of loan of 30,000 AFN, and they are appreciative of the process by which loans are made available.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander M. is from the village of Valencia, Bukidnon. He is 47 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Alexander owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling gasoline in the local community. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alexander joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alexander is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

texts.en:

Mohtob wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a fruit-selling cart.

Safai wants to take a loan for the business of bag weaving.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe B., from Valencia City, is 34 years old and the married mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Phoebe owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from buying and selling a variety of vegetables in the local community. Engaged in the business over 2 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Phoebe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
At the age of 62, Magdalena G. is widowed and doing her best to move her family out of poverty in a way that causes no one else harm. She has always prayed to the Lord to guide her in the proper way of living and He responded by giving her the chance to became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), an institution that has been instrumental in helping the family to increase their income.

For 10 years now the family has operated a fabric remnant business from their home, an enterprise that has provided sufficient income for their daily expenses. As well, for additional income they make rags using fabric remnant. Magdelina is now requesting her seventh loan in order to expand the business.

Magdalena hopes that her business will always provide revenue so that she can save for her grandsons’ higher education, an opportunity that most of her children were denied.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, a 39-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 12 and 14 , all of whom attend school, owns a two-room house with electricity but no piped water. Edith, who also takes care of additional family members, resides there with six other people. For the past four years she has rented a retail shop on the outskirts of Kampala for 50000/= per month, selling day-to-day essentials on a retail basis. Edith buys her merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and thus incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include increasing transportation and product costs.

A member of MCDT for eight years, she is now requesting her twentieth loan to buy more merchandise with the goals of seeing her business grow stronger and eventually selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
D. Phạm Thị (10102110027) is a 28 year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, D. works in a family member's business providing construction services to local community members. D. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $224 US) a month from these activities.

In 2006, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 dong from SEDA. This previous loan was used to expand the business. D. is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 dong which will be used to expand the business. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

D. Phạm Thị (10102110027) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, D. Cùng kinh doanh với một thành viên khác trong gia đình. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xây dựng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2006, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. D. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. D. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with six people. Mayi takes care of additional family members as well. The family has access to electricity, but no running water.

Mayi has a stall selling charcoal. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for 8 years and with MCDT for 1 year. Her challenges include transportation, the increasing price of charcoal and the rainy season. Mayi wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She wants to develop her business and start selling only wholesale.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business of Emilyn B.. Aside from this, she also sells vegetables in their village to earn more income. She would like to have her business maintained and she needs additional capital to do it. In connection with this, she is borrowing a loan amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos for the development and growth of her business. She is planning to purchase more hogs and a sufficient supply of feed for her pigs. The loan she is requesting can help her a lot in maintaining her business; that’s why she prays that her loan will be approved.

Emilyn is 32 years old and a mother of two. Her eldest is 12 years old and her youngest is 7 years old. They are both studying in primary school near their village. Emilyn is married to Edwin, who is employed as a construction worker. The couple is hoping to provide all the needs of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more hogs and sufficient supply of feed

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy S. lives in Chhoeur Teal village in Takeo province. She sells duck eggs and breeds pigs. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Neth, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. On this farm, he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil.

In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Nhy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice field. She is 52 years old and the mother of a child who attends the local school.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for the rice field

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat K. lives in Chhoeur Teal Phlos village in Takeo province. She breeds ducks. Her husband, Mr. Meas Suy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. He has a problem because his field has infertile soil. So, Mrs. Phat K. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the rest of money to buy duck food for her poultry business.

She is 44 years old and the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local school and the other helps with the poultry business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for the rice field and buy duck food for the poultry business

loans.name: Grace Caroline

texts.en:
Grace Caroline C. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Grace Caroline is married and has three young children. To make a living, Grace Caroline operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of products at her mini store and by selling processed foods like tocino, longganiza, hot dogs, etc., to the local community. Grace Caroline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace Caroline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace Caroline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Grace Caroline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en: Nosa sells clothes and body creams in the market. She is 28 years old and married with a child. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She requests a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes and body creams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and body creams to sell

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 50 years old and widowed with six children between the ages of 16 and 26 years old. Three of her children go to school. She resides in, and owns, a four room house where she is staying with six people. Teddy takes care of additional family members, too. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. 

Teddy has a stall for selling food at her home, so she doesn’t pay rent nor monthly market dues. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for six years, servicing her third loan. She doesn’t pay rent for business premises, but pays weekly market expenses of 2000/=. 

Teddy buys bananas from vendors with delivery trucks, who get them from villages, and so she doesn’t incur transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and increasing prices due to persistent drought in many villages in Uganda. Teddy wants to use this loan to buy more sacks and bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and start selling only on wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng C. lives in Chrouy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She also sells fruit in the local market. Her business is doing well, so she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell to earn more income.

Mrs. Kheng C. is a 45-year-old widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Purchase more fruit to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Edna is married and has six children who attend school. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Edna has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire B. is 31 years old and is married with five children aged 3 through 12 years. She lives in Burera district, Northern Province, Rwanda.

Marie Claire has been in the potato business for three years and she employs four people from her local community in her shop. Work begins at her business at 4 a.m. each day, lasting until 4:30 in the evening.

Marie Claire is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company so that she can buy larger quantities of potatoes and, she hopes, secure better pricing. This will allow her to serve her existing clients better and to attract new customers as well.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of potatoes

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Mrs. Toch V. is a villager in Chrouy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Nou Tum, is a fisherman and he uses the electric cow for transportation and to plow the field.

Mrs. Toch V. is 32 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom attends the local school; the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve the rice field

loans.name: Marie Gay Rose

texts.en:
“Time is Gold”: this is the guiding principle of Marie Gay. She wants to use her time as much as possible to be productive in her business. She needs to be patient to be able to provide for the needs of her children, especially when it comes to their educational needs. Marie, as she is known, is married to Merlito. The couple has two school-age children. 

Marie runs a general store in her village. She buys commodities in Cauayan, Isabela, once a month. According to her, she has been in business for seven years and she tries to maintain it for the sake of her children. Marie is requesting to obtain a loan of 16,000 PHP for the maintenance and continuous development of her business. Since being in this organization for almost five years, her retail business has become more competent and she is always thankful for it. She hopes that it will be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For maintenance and development of her business

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita R. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Marita is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Marita has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna sells frozen food items, such as turkey, chicken, and fish, to make a living. She is a widow with seven children and she is 54 years old. She takes care of her children alone and she hopes to give them a quality education. Anna lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders .

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta enjoys farming. She is happy to share that her rice crops are growing well. According to her, her farm needs good care to produce a quality harvest. At 52, she has two children with her husband, Bonifacio. Her eldest child is 18 years old. 

Violeta is a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to acquire the farm supplies that she needs for her farm.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia T. is from the village of Cabanglasan,  Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Aurelia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Aurelia owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she sells vegetables and spices in the local community. Aurelia has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheng A. lives in Cham Bork Tim village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve the rice field. So, she decided to ask for a loan to make these purchases.

Mrs. Pheng A. is a 57-year-old widow with two children; one is a motorbike taxi driver and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve the rice field

loans.name: Rosanne

texts.en: Rosanne has been married to her husband, Alvin, for more than three years. They have one child who is two years old. Rosanne is a rice farmer. In November of 2008, she became a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., which is now a Kiva partner. She particularly likes the low interest rate offered by the MFI. She applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies she needs for her farm to grow.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 42 years old and has six children. He owns a workshop where he repairs all types of bicycles, and he also sells spare parts and accessories for the bicycles. Khaled operates the workshop every day and is visited by various clients in his establishment in Gaza city of Palestine.

Today, he has come to Ryada to benefit from a loan and this is why he hopes that his loan will be approved immediately, so that he can buy tools and continue his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon S. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Sorn (pictured here), is a farmer who owns 1-hectare field of land where he cultivates rice.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn very little to support their family. So Mrs. Phon S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Phon S. is 60 years old and her son is a policeman.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Hoàng Thị's Group

texts.en:
Bac Hoang Thi is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Dong Anh, Hanoi. Bac is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mach Trang (2).

Bac is married and has two school-age children.  To making a living, Bac operates a family member's business of raising chickens for sale. Bac has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.

In 2004, Bac joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bac has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.300.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.322.000 VND, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Bac plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Bui Thi C., 55, is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

2.  Nguyen Thi Lai, 53, is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business of raising crops.

3.  Dong Thi Nam, 30, is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business of raising crops.

4.  Tran Thi H., 27, is requesting a 2.668.000 VND loan to support her business of providing recycling services.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wilsa

texts.en:
Wilsa E. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 30 years old. Wilsa is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Wilsa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Wilsa has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wilsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilsa is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a diligent farmer. She tills her rice field with her husband. At 60, she is still strong enough to take care of her farm. She was able to produce 70 sacks on her last harvest. She aims to produce more on the next cropping. To achieve that, she has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizer and other supplies that her farm needs. Adelaida is positive that this loan can help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun N. was born in 1977 and she lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She also breeds pigs. Her breeding pigs business is going well, so she wants to expand it by purchasing eight more piglets for breeding and pig food.

Her husband, Mr. Eam Saroem (pictured here), is a teacher in the local school. This couple has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy eight more piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 56 years old. She is a widow with four children. She makes bird feed to sell in bags to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bird feed to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make bird feed to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy has been helping her husband by selling fish and frozen food, such as longganisa (sausage) in their village. For additional income, she also now sells bottles and steel in their village and in the junk shops. Through the loan she obtained from lenders, she was also able to purchase one hog and is now trying to grow her business for more profit. Daisy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional working capital to further expand her business. She hopes that she will again be entrusted with the loan she is asking.

Daisy is 32 years old and is married to Tito, who works as a driver in Cauayan City. They are blessed with four children, three of whom are studying in primary school. Their youngest is just a year old. The couple is trying to work hard in their daily activities so that they can sustain all the needs of their children especially now that most of them are in school. Daisy hopes that her business will further grow to be more profitable.

loans.use: For expansion of her businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina M. is from the village of Bayabason, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 39 years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Fedelina sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Fedelina has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fedelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Fedelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fedelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama is the group leader of the Fatama Group. There are three members in this group. Each of them has business expansion goals she wishes to meet. For this reason, the four women have requested a group loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghani.

- Fatama wants to take out a loan for her husband, who owns a general store.

- Gul Sohom wants to apply her loan toward her son's tailoring business.

- Halima would like to use her loan for her carpet-weaving business.

All the members of this group are very happy to have the opportunity to request these loans from Kiva lenders, who can support all entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: For the expansion of the members' individual businesses

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San S. lives in the village of Ta O Choeurng in the province of Takeo. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She presently faces an obstacle in her planting because of infertile soil in her field. For this reason, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump, fertilizers, and pesticides to support her plantation.

She is 39 years old and the mother of a one-year-old baby and a three-year-old child. Her husband, Mr. Kong Khen, pictured at left, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a water pump, fertilizers, and pesticides for her rice plot

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola  is 35 years old and married with one child. She has a tailoring shop in front of her house.  She has been in the business for the past eight years.  She hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sew.  She say thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old and married to Edgar, a businessman. They have two children: Jay Mar, who is 12 years old and in grade 6, and Jarred Dane, who is 6 years old and in grade 1. They live in the city proper of Cauayan, Isabela. 

Agnes manages a mini-restaurant next to Cauayan Medical Specialist Hospital. Her net income a week is 1,800 PHP.  She wishes to expand her business for it to become more profitable. This is the reason why she is borrowing a loan of 30,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders for her to pursue her plans in her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her food vending business

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy M. lives in the village of Si Sla in the province of Takeo. Her income comes from selling Khmer cake. Her husband, Mr. Soem Sam (pictured at right) is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates both rice and corn. He presently faces an obstacle with his corn cultivation, but he does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to work in the field. For this reason, Mrs. Nhy M. has decided to ask for a loan for her husband to use in his farming endeavors.

She is 37 years old and is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to work in the field

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. is from the village of Sabacan Panadtalan, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Daisy is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Daisy has been in business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Daisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP ,which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nhinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhinh P. lives in the village of Tuol Kandal in the province of Takeo. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Keo, are farmers who own a three-hectare field of land where they earn a living by cultivating rice.

They face a problem in their planting because of infertile soil in their field, which negatively affects the success of their crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Nhinh P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, which will support the rice field and make the crops more productive.

She is 48 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer. The other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the rice field and make the crops more productive

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 53 years old and married with six children. She sells food, such as garri (food item made from cassava tubers) and fish. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia S. is from the village of Basag, San Calos. She is 43 years old. Vivencia is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Vivencia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Vivencia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vivencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Vivencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vivencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Mrs. Nur P., born in 1979, lives in the village of Tuol Kandal in the province of Takeo. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. She is requesting a loan, part of which will be used to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and part of which will be used to hire laborers to work in the rice field.

Her husband, Mr. Vong Chhoeun (pictured at left), is a fisherman and a construction worker. Of their three children, two are enrolled in the local school, and one is as yet too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides as well as to hire laborers to work on the rice field

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy S. is a villager in the village of Ta Preas in the province of Takeo. She owns a rice mill which is used by other farmers. She is also a farmer herself and owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. In her planting work, she presently faces an obstacle because her field is far from any irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump and some hoS. through which to pump water to support the rice field.

Her husband, Mr. Him Thy, pictured at right, is a construction worker. He helps his wife’s work through his construction work.

Mrs. Sothy S. is 32 years old and is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and some hoses through which to pump water to support the rice field

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a 54-year-old married woman with six children aged 8 to 20 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-room house where she lives with six people. Cissy takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  

She has a stall selling second-hand clothes and works from her home. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for 10 years. Cissy buys used clothes from Owino market and so incurs transport costs. Her challenges include transportation and increasing prices of second-hand clothes.  

Cissy wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She hopes to see her business grow stronger and start selling only on wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been selling generic medicines for four years. She purchases her products at RTL, located in Ilagan, Isabela. She sells her products in her village with a higher price for her to earn an income. According to her, she needs additional capital to further expand her business. She believes that the more capital she has, the more income she will gain that is why she wants to borrow a loan of Php13,000 to be used as additional capital for her to expand her generic medicine vending.


At the age of 59, Josefina is still working hard. She sees her business as a hobby. She lives in the village of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela together with her husband and two children. Four of their children now have their own families. Josefina hopes for their good health and a peaceful life.

loans.use: Additional capital to further expand her generic medicines vending

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad, 35 years old, is married with three children.  All his children are currently in school.  Imad's main activity is selling fruit and vegetables.  As of now, this is his only source of income. 

This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan from Ryada. This loan will let him purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell and therefore improve his business by being able to provide a larger variety of goods. He needs a loan in the amount of USD 2000. He promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene owns a computer center where he renders computer services and also sells rechargeable phone cards. He is 33 years old and single without any children. He lives in Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Mr. Srurn Khai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of sixteen people who live in the village of Tao Chanthy in the province of Takeo.

Mr. Srurn K. is the village bank president, elected by the members. He is a farmer who has a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to earn his living. In his farming work, he presently faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field. For this reason, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers in order to make his crop more productive.

His wife, Mrs. Choeuk Phall, helps him with his business. They have five children, two of whom are blacksmiths. The younger ones attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers in order to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Kim Pao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are nine members of this village bank. They live in the village of Prey Mul in the province of Takeo. The members have selected Mrs. Sok Kim P. to be the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn her living.

Her husband, Mr. Sreng Seing, is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, and for this reason his wife has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's breeding business.

Mrs. Sok Kim P. is 29 years old and is the mother of three children. The eldest attends the local school and the two youngest are as yet too young to work or study.

loans.use: Tto buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's breeding business

loans.name: Nhung's Group

texts.en:
"Nhung N. Thị (10114140003) is a 38 year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  Nhung is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tuân Lề (1).


Nhung is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Nhung operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only sales, the daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste are the largest selling items to the surrounding community.  Nhung has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Nhung joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.724.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.758.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Nhung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Phạm Thị Tú (10114140005) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Hoàng Thị H. (10114140002) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Đỗ Thị Y. (10114140004) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  N. Thị T. (10114140001) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3.706.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nhung N. Thị (10114140003) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  Nhung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tuân Lề (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nhung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhung kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2003, Nhung đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.724.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.758.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Phạm Thị Tú (10114140005) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Hoàng Thị H. (10114140002) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Đỗ Thị Y. (10114140004) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. Thị T. (10114140001) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.706.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags

loans.name: Mrs. Kai Chhean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 15 people who live in the village of Dong in the province of Takeo. Each group member plans to use the loan for individual business purposes.

Mrs. Kai C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Leom Sareourn, are farmers. Although they work hard, they still earn less income than is needed to support their family. In order to improve the living conditions of the family, Mrs. Kai C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a sugar cane juice box to start a new business.

Mrs. Kai C. is 40 years old and is the mother of five children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a sugar cane juice box to start a new business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret D. is a frozen foods store owner who sells frozen chicken fish and other frozen foods in Abotoase. Margaret has received senior high education.  She is married and the husband is also a petty trader whose income is too small to care for the financial needs of the family. 

Margaret has been selling these frozen chickens, fish and other frozen foods since for the past 6 years. She is responsible for the payments of the utility bills. With the high demand for her frozen foods and meats, her loan will be used to buy to more of the frozen fish and meat for sale. She hopes to reinvest the profit from her business.

loans.use: to more frozen fish and meat

loans.name: Juliao Eugenio

texts.pt:
Julião T. nasceu em Chibuto Distrito da Província de Gaza, ao sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos de 1 a 18 anos de idade, destes 5 vão à escola. Fez 7ª classe e não foi possível continuar devido à falta de condições financeiras. Vive numa casa própria com a família com a sua mãe.

Saiu de chibuto em 1983 a Maputo em casa de seus tios, para continuar com os seus estudos. Depois de casamento fixou a sua própria residência em Boane, onde reside ate data hoje.
Ė funcionário da Saúde em Boane ha mais de 18 anos, tem um salário mensal de 2.900.00MT. Para alem deste, presta serviço a terceiros com o qual consegue render ate 1.500.00MT e poupa algum na sua conta Bancária.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos, nunca levantou empréstimos em outras instituições bancárias. Este é o seu 4º credito na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00MT, com o qual pretende comprar cimento, barrotes, chapas, ferro e pagamento de mão de obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.500.00MT, 7.500.00MT e 10.000.00MT todos para a compra de material de construção.

O seu objectivo com este empréstimo, é melhorar a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial para venda de bebidas e produtos de primeira necessidade.
texts.en:
Julião T. was born in Chibuto district of the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is 43 years old, married and father of six children aged one through 18. Of these, five go to school. He finished seventh grade and was not able to continue his studies because of financial conditions. He lives in his own house with his family and his mother. He left Chibuto in 1983 for Maputo and the home of his relatives in order to continue with his studies. After his marriage, he settled down in Boane, where he still lives today. He has worked as a civil servant in the Department of Health in Boane for more than 18 years. He has a salary of 2,900 MT. In addition to this, he provides various services to others for which he earns up to 1,5000 MT, and saves some in his bank account. He got to know Hluvuku through friends, and has never taken out loans from other banking institutions. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 MT, with which he plans to buy cement, beams, sheet metal, iron and pay the workers. The previous loans were for 5,500 MT, 7,500 MT and 10,000 MT, all for buying construction materials. His objective with this loan is to improve his house and offer better living conditions to his family. In future, in plans to request more loans to build a business establishment to sell drinks and basic necessities.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (bricks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Mrs. Thorn Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The president of this village bank, selected by its 19 members, is Mrs. Thorn C.. Like her fellow group members, she lives in the village of Dong in the province of Takeo. Each member of the group intends to use the loan for individual business purposes.

Mrs. Thorn C. is a silk weaver, so she is requesting the loan to buy more silk to weave. She also buys baskets to re-sell in the local village. Her husband, Mr. T. Hi, is a farmer who makes a small income to support the family.

Mrs. Thorn C. is 47 years old and is the mother of three children, who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave and more baskets to re-sell in the village

loans.name: Ruth Mateus

texts.pt:
Ruth Nhacula nasceu em mahena, na província de Inhambane, de 51 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos de 11, 16, 20, 28,29 e 31 anos de idade, destes os 3 últimos vão à escola. Fez 8ª classe e não foi possível continuar com os estudos devido à falta de condições financeiras. Vivem na casa própria com a família mais 2 parentes do marido.

Saiu de Inhambane em 1980 com o seu marido a procura de emprego. Vivia numa casa alugada depois de casamento, começou com a obra de construção da sua própria casa (ainda em construção), onde vive actualmente com sua família no distrito de Boane.

Ė negociante há 14 anos, aprendeu esta actividade com suas amigas do bairro onde vive não tem trabalhadores, por mês consegue um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00MT. Deste valor conseguem poupar algum com as amigas através do sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de credito, conheceu a Hluvuku através do senhor Francisco Zandamela, um dos Clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00MT com o qual pretende comprar areia, pedra, cimento e outros. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00MT, 15.000.00MT e 20.000.00MT todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos a esta instituição para a conclusão da sua obra e comprar mobiliário da casa.
texts.en:
Ruth Nhacula was born in Mahena in the Province of Inhambane. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of six children, aged 11, 16, 20, 28, 29 and 31 years. Of these, the three youngest go to school. She got her grade eight and was unable to continue with her studies due to financial conditions. She lives in her own house with her family and two of her husband's relatives. She left Inhambane in 1980 with her husband to look for work. She lived in a rented house after getting married. She began construction work on her own house (which is still under construction) where she presently lives with her family in the district of Boane. She has been a businesswoman for 14 years. She learned to do this with friends from the neighbourhood where she lives. She has no employees. Each month she manages to get an income of about 15,000 MT. From this amount she manages to save some with her friends through a traditional savings system (Xitique). She has never worked with other credit institutions. She got to know about Hluvuku through Mr. Francisco Zandamela, one of the clients of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 MT, with which she plans to buy sand, stone, cement and other items. The previous loans were for 10,000 MT, 15,000 MT and 20,000 MT, all for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans from this institution in order to finish her construction work and purchase furniture for the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (bricks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Chukwuka

texts.en: Chukwuka has a photo studio where he snaps pictures. He is 27 years old and single without any children. He is requesting a loan  of N100,000 to purchase a digital camera to enable him meet the desires of his clients. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke sells yam. She is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in the business of selling yams for the past 15 years.  She is requesting N40,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She say thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: more yams to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha D. sells fertilizers and other Agro Chemicals in Abotoase. Martha has received senior high education.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a domestic farmer.  Martha is responsible for the payment of school fees, rent and utility bills for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more Agro chemicals to sell. She hopes to reinvest the profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more Agro chemicals to sell.

loans.name: Constancia Daniel

texts.pt:
Constância Catela E. nasceu em Maganja da costa, na província nortenha de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 01,07 e 12 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão à escola. Esta a fazer o 3º ano de faculdade de ciências pedagógicas na Universidade Pedagógica.
Vive na casa própria com a família e uma sobrinha, o seu marido trabalha como serralheiro a conta própria.

Saiu de Zambézia para Maputo ainda jovem com sua irmã, a fim de continuar com os estudos, desde então não voltou mais para Zambézia tendo mais tarde instalado a sua residência no distrito de boane, onde vive ate hoje.

É professora efectiva há 06 anos e faz 05 horas diárias, formou-se no IMAP-Matola (Instituto do Magistério Primário da Matola) há 07 anos, actualmente aufere um salário mensal de 5.676,00MT, poupa algum mensalmente no Banco comercial (BIM).

Já fez empréstimo na PROCREDIT (Uma instituição Moçambicana de credito), no valor de 50.000.00MT destinados à aquisição de um meio de transporte depois decidiu não continuar por vários motivos.
Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT com o qual pretende comprar blocos, pedras, areia e outros. 

Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo, pois pretende continuar a pedir mais para poder concluir a obra e depois mobilar.
texts.en:
Constância Catela E. was born in Maganja da Costa in the northern province of Mozambique. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children aged 1, 7 and 12 years. The two oldest children go to school. She is in her third year at the faculty of pedagogical sciences at the Pedagogical University. She lives in her own house with her family and a niece. Her husband works for himself as a locksmith. When she was still young, she left Zambezia for Maputo with her sister for the purposes of continuing with her studies. Since then she has not returned again to Zambezia, as she later moved into her residence in the district of Boane, where she still lives today. She has been a teacher for six years and works five hours a day, having graduated from IMAP-Matola (Institute of Elementary Education of Matola) seven years ago. Currently, she receives a monthly salary of 5,676 MT, and saves some every month in the commercial bank BIM. She has already had a loan from PROCREDIT (a Mozambican credit institution) in the amount of 50,000 MT, which was intended for the acquisition of a means of transportation, but she decided not to continue with it afterwards for various reasons. She got to know about Hluvuku through a friend, and this is her first loan in the amount of 15,000 MT, with which she plans to buy bricks, stones, sand and other items. She promises to repay the loan faithfully, since she plans to continue to ask for more money in order to be able to finish construction and then get furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan T. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread along side the road in an open place.  She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of sugar and baking flour.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to develop her place along the side of the road into a restaurant.  She will do this by building a structure with iron sheets for the both the walls and the roof. 

Juan is 25 years old and is married to a soldier.  She has no children.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of sugar and baking flour

loans.name: Rita Fernando

texts.pt:
Rita Fernando U. nasceu em Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade, é divorciada e mãe de 01 filho de 10 anos de idade. Estudou ate 5ªclasse parou de estudar por falta de alguém que lhe dessa assistência e lhe mostrasse a importância da escola, pois seu pai trabalhava na África do Sul (Pais vizinho de Moçambique). Ela cresceu com os avos, vive na casa própria em Boane e para alem do filho sustenta 02 sobrinhos órfãos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Boane para cidade de Maputo devido à guerra de desestabilização, regressa em 1995 para continuar com a sua vida normal. Actualmente tem um negocio próprio há mais de 10 anos, não tem trabalhadores, mas seu irmão tem lhe auxiliado de vez enquanto. O produto que vende mais é a cerveja que vende por 25.00MT a media, tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00MT por mês, poupa algum dinheiro fazendo (Xitique) um sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições de credito, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua mãe que também é cliente da instituição. Este é seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT com o qual pretende comprar refrigerantes, bebidas, e produtos de mercearia. O empréstimo anterior foi de 6.000.00MT também para a mesma actividade.

Com presente empréstimo espera melhorar bastante o seu negocio através de aumento da quantidade de produtos e ajudar a responder as necessidades primarias da família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Rita Fernando U. was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She's 30, divorced and the mother of a 10 year old boy. Besider her son, she also supports two nephews who live with them. She was raised by her grandparents and dropped school in 5th grade. She's had her own business for the past 10 years; she has no employees, but her brother helps her from time to time. Her best selling product is beer, and she makes around 5.000,00MT (U$175) per month in profit, which she uses to support her household and save for the future. This is her second loan with this institution. She's asking for 10.000,00MT (U$350) to buy sodas, alcoholic beverages and other food products to sell in her store. She hopes to improve her business and give her kids a better life.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for reselling

loans.name: Adijatu

texts.en: Adijatu sells plastic in front of her house. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She is requested for a loan of N40,000 to purchase more plastic to sell. She say thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic items to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara K. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Sara sells plastic products such as plastic plates, bowls and containers in Abotoase.  She has been doing this business for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. Sara uses her income to pay for utility bills and school fees for the children. Sara will use the loan to purchase more of the plastic wares for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sara plans to save for the future!

loans.use: to purchase more of the plastic wares for sale.

loans.name: Ecitel

texts.pt:
Nb. Não foi possível a foto no local do negocio porque faz em regime ambulatório e por encomenda.

Ecitel Fernando M. nasceu em Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 02 filhos de 15 e 5 anos de idade, todos vão à escola, estudou ate 8ªclasse parou de estudar quando ficou grávida, pois foi obrigada a cuidar do filho uma vez que o namorado negou de assumir as responsabilidades. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta 02 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Maputo para Namaacha (distrito localizado ao sul da cidade de Maputo e que faz fronteira com Suazilândia) quando a sua mãe se separa do seu pai. 
É negociante ambulante de potes a mais de oito anos, aprendeu a fazer o negocio sozinha depois de ter tentado vender refrigerantes. O seu rendimento mensal varia de 6.000,00MT a 7.000,00MT, com este rendimento consegue sustentar a família e poupar algum para melhorar a sua habitação.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de credito e este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000,00MT, com o qual pretende comprar potes de alumínio para poder responderem à demanda e consequentemente os seus rendimentos vão melhorar. O primeiro foi de 10.000,00MT destinado à mesma actividade. 

Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e investir cada vez mais no seu negocio.
texts.en:
Ecitel Fernando M. is from Maputo, Mozambique. She is 31, single, and has two kids ages 5 and 15, both students. She finished 8th grade but had to drop school because she got pregnant. The kid's son never helped her. She lives in her own house and in the top of her two sons, she also supports two nephews who live with her. She is a house to house seller of pots and has been doing it for 8 years. She previously worked selling sodas but that didn't work out.
