loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena H. D. C. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad en el municipio  D. Colon. María D. 40 años D. edad se encuentra separada D. su esposo y actualmente solo vive con sus dos hijos Javier D. 19 años D. edad y Ángela D. 12 años D. edad. María no recibe ayuda del padre D. sus hijos pero el hijo mayor D. María es un gran respaldo para ella, ya que a pesar D. ser estudiar  a adquirido un trabajo D. medio tiempo, para obtener ingresos y ayudar a su madre con algunos gastos del hogar, María por su lado atienD. su negocio,  una sala D. belleza y  tienda con inventarios en productos cosméticos y cuidado personal, para María es muy importante adquirir este crédito;  para invertir en nueva mercadería y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
María resides in the municipality of Colón, La Libertad department. María is 40 years old and separated from her husband. Presently, she lives with her 2 children only, 19 year old Javier and 12 year old Ángela. María does not receive help from the father of her children but her son is a great help to her. In addition to studying, he has acquired a part-time job, to earn income and to help his mother with household expenses.

María, for her part, attends to her business, a beauty salon and store with inventories of personal care and cosmetic products. For María it is very important to obtain this loan, to invest in merchandise and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO SUPPLY HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Lucia Del Rosario

texts.es: Lucia Del Rosario D. reside en el departamento de San Salvador capital del país. Lucia de 36 años de edad vive con su  esposo y sus tres hijos aun menores de edad estudiantes. Lucia es una mujer emprendedora maneja su propio negocio ubicado en su casa, donde vende tortillas todas las tardes, Lucia mantiene una clientela estable ya que es conocida por sus vecinos por años, el crédito que solicita Lucia es para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para ampliar su negocio y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Lucia Del Rosario D. lives in the deapartment of San Salvador in the country's capital. Lucia is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their three children who are still too young to be in school. Lucia is an entrepreneurial woman who manages her own business out of her home, where she sells tortillas every afternoon. Lucia has a strong client base since her neighbors have known her for years. The loan that Lucia is requesting will go towards the purchase of more corn to expand her business and to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel P. L. reside en unos de los municipios  más poblados de  San Salvador llamado Soyapango. Miguel tienen 59 años de edad  vive con su esposa, la  hija, su yerno y el nieto. Miguel ha sido siempre una persona muy creativa para  la creación de artefactos con hierro, esas habilidades llevan a Miguel a poner su negocio de artículos hecho con diversos tipos de hierro, la mayoría de pedidos son de jaulas para variedad de animales, pero Miguel no solo trabaja en sus diseños hechos con hierro; también maneja una pequeña venta de granos básicos. El solicita de un crédito para invertir en su inventario de granos básicos y también para adquirir más variedad de hierro para seguir fabricando otros tipo de productos para ser comercializados.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel P. L. lives in one of the most heavily populated municipalities of San Salvador, which is called Soyapango. Miguel is 59. He lives with his wife, his daughter, his son-in-law, and his grandchild. Miguel has always been a very creative person in creating devices made from iron. This ability has caused Miguel to start a business of selling things made from different types of metal. Most of the orders are for cages for a variety of animals. Miguel does not only work on designs made with iron. He also manages a small business selling basic grains. He is asking for a loan to buy basic grains for his inventory. He will also get a greater variety of iron to keep making other types of products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase the production of his products

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira Elizabeth C. H. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Yanira de 29 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija. Yanira maneja su propio negocio ubicado en el mercado de San Martin donde ofrece zapatos y cosméticos, son siete años de experiencias en las ventas que caracterizan y marcan a Yanira que posee de una buena clientela, el crédito que solicita es para destinarlo en la compra de nuevos productos para su negocio los cuales los adquirirá comprándolos al por mayor y así obtener precios mas baratos, para generar mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Yanira Elizabeth C. H. lives in the Ilopango municipality in the San Salvador department. Yanira is 29, and she lives with her husband and her daughter. Yanira runs her own business, which is located in the San Martin market. She sells shoes and cosmetics. She has seven years of experience in sales. Yanira has good customers. The loan she is asking for is to buy new products for her business. She will buy the products wholesale in order to get cheaper prices. This will generate a greater margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Hamana

texts.en: Hamana is 33 years old and married with two children. She sells motor parts and has been in business for the past 13 years. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more motor parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor parts to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia tiene 63 años y está casada hace 30 años. Ella y su marido trabajan en la producción de leche cruda  y en la agricultura cultivando maíz, papa, cebolla, alfa alfa y zanahoria. Ellos empezaron con 2 cabezas de  ganado  lechero  y actualmente cuentan con 6 cabezas de ganados lechero. 

La señora Cecilia tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 25 años, ellos estudian  carreras técnicas, el hijo mayor 
estudia veterinaria para que en el futuro pueda ayudar a sus padres en el cuidado de su ganado,  el  hijo menor estudia técnico superior en mecánico. Entre sus sueños  y metas de doña Cecilia es ver profesional  a  sus hijos para que puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida. 

El  préstamo será destinado para la compra de una ordeñadora, esto  disminuirá el trabajo manual  y aumentara los litros de leche producidos. Este es el cuarto  crédito que otorga nuestra institución  a la señora Cecilia con los cuales  logro construir su casa, aumentar su ganado lechero y  los más importante  hacer  que los dos hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 63 years old and has been married for 30 years. She and her husband work in raw milk production and farming corn, potatoes, onion, alfalfa and carrots. They began with two head of dairy cattle and now have six .Cecilia has two sons, 20 and 25 years old, who are studying technical careers. The eldest studies veterinary science so that in the future he can help his parents care for their cattle. The younger son is studying to be a mechanic. Among Cecilia's dreams is to see her sons become professionals so that they may have a better quality of life. The funds requested will be used to buy a milking machine which will reduce the manual labor and increase the quantity of milk produced. This is the fourth loan our institution has granted Cecilia. With past loans she managed to build her house, increase the number of cows and, most importantly, allow her sons to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking machine.

loans.name: Silvia Angélica

texts.es: Silvia Angélica S. D. H.  resiD. en Sacacoyo en el departamento D. La Libertad. Silvia tiene 41 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos D. 18, 14, 13 y 10 años D. edad todos se encuentran estudiando. Silvia y su esposo se apoyan mutuamente en los gastos familiares, ya que sus cuatro hijos se encuentran estudiando simultáneamente, para esta pareja es muy difícil todos los gastos mensuales, es por ello que Silvia se decidió apoyar a su esposo; con una pequeña tienda que ha instalado desD. su casa, la cual ahora por medio D. este crédito pretenD. surtir, para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia Angélica S. D. H. lives in Sacacoyo in the La Libertad department. Silvia, 41, lives with her husband and their four children. The children are 18, 14, 13, and 10. They go to school. Silvia and her husband mutually support each other with the family expenses. Since their four children are all in school at the same time, meeting the monthly expenses is difficult for this couple. That is why Silvia decided to help her husband by setting up a small store in her house. With this loan she now aims to stock the store in order to generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Las Principiantes Group

texts.es:
Las Principiantes, así se hacen llamar un grupo de 9 mujeres y un varón  que pertenecen al Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, todas trabajan con mucha tenacidad y perseverancia en los negocios que han emprendido y están juntos  hace 7 años aproximadamente, su actual presidenta es Jimena. 
Una de las integrantes es Julia de 43 años, ella es parte de este grupo desde que se ha fundado e indica que ha sido gran apoyo los créditos que Pro Mujer le ha podido otorgar, ya que tiene el negocio de venta de motores y repuestos,  cuándo se le consulta de cómo ingresó al negocio, ella indica que su esposo es mecánico y muchas personas que venían a hacer arreglar los motores de sus movilidades algunos querían comprar motores nuevos o mejores de los que tenían actualmente y ella decidió vender los motores y no solo eso sino otros repuestos de movilidad, recuerda que con su primer préstamo compro anillas. Con el pasar del tiempo su esposo consiguió  trabajo y ella no tuvo más el asesoramiento de su esposo en la venta y compra de motores. Entonces incursiono en otro nuevo negocio como la venta de tenis y lo vende en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, para lo cual necesita el nuevo préstamo.
Al igual que Julia sus compañeras tienen diferentes y variados negocios como la venta de salchipapa, servicio de transporte y confección de polleras (faldas).
texts.en:
Las Principiantes (The Beginners) is a group of 9 women and one man who belong to the Juan Pablo II focus center. They are all hard workers and very tenacious in the various enterprises they have entered into and have been together approximately 7 years. The current president is Jimena. One of the members is Julia, 43. She has been a member of this group since its founding and she states that the loans that ProMujer has been able to provide have been a great help for her motors and motor parts sales business. When she is asked how it was that she got into this kind of business, she relates that her husband is a mechanic and many of his customers who would come in for repairs often wanted to buy new motors or better models of the ones they currently owned. So, she decided to sell motors and, not only that, but replacement part, too. She remembers that with her first loan she purchased piston rings. With time, her husband got a new job so she could no longer count on his expertise in the motor buying and selling business so she began a new enterprise: the sale of tennis shoes which she sells at the 16 of July Fair (Market) in the city of El Alto. It is for this new activity that she needs this new loan. Like Julia, her partners have different and varied activities such as the sale of salchipapa (a dish made of potatoes and fried sausage), transportation services and skirt making.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock items, consumibles and raw materials.

loans.name: Mujeres De Progreso 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
MarieL., 20, lives near San PedR. D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres D. Progreso (Women of Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

MarieL. is a very amiable young woman with a knack for business. She lives on her own and is already supporting herself at a young age. MarieL. runs a small “colmado y fantasia”, or food and general store. MarieL. will use this loan to purchase Dominican cuisine, such as rice, beans, oil, milk, and some pastries. She will also sell perfumes, jewelry, wristwatches, and other trinkets. 

MarieL. lives in Andres Boca Chica, a town between San PedR. D. Macorís and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. It is a town known for tourism, and MarieL. sells many of her trinkets to local tourists. She hopes that someday, she can run a mini-market with many more products. MarieL. speaks English well, and, with her hard work, she clearly has earned the respect of her elders by being named group coordinator. She is very thankful for Esperanza, and said that it has “provided the best opportunity to look forward to the future”. Thank you for lending to MarieL. and the Mujeres D. Progreso group!

loans.use: Food, perfumes, and jewelry

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence M. is 33 years old, married with four children aged 7 through 15 years, and takes care of three persons aged 16, 17 and 19 years.

Laurence lives in Nyarugenge district where she has sold cooking oil and shoes since 1994, employing five people from her community. Her business is open everyday from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m.

Laurence is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more cooking oil to sell so that she earns more profit.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia B. who lives in the village Cadiz City. She is 59 years old, and married to Rosendo B. who works as a laborer in a local sugarcane plantation.  A laborer earns a very small salary and is sometimes not enough to sustain the family's needs especially with five children.  Four of their children are adults and one is still attending school. Rosendo also receives a small pension because he is over 60, but continues to work in the sugarcane plantation to earn a living. Virginia dreams to be able to pull her family out of their current situation, and is doing her utmost to earn more.
 
Several years ago, Virginia was looking for a good opportunity to help her husband, and then decided to start her own business. In 2002 she was able to become a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and borrow enough capital for her proposed business, for a general store. She was able to earn a good income that helped in defraying household expenses. Sadly, the general store was in trouble and she had to shut it down. But she was able to borrow enough capital to open a computer gaming shop which was very popular among the youth. The two computer workstations earn her an average of PHP 2,500 per month.

For her previous loan she borrowed PHP 8,000 to do some maintenance work on her equipment and for additional working capital. She fully paid her loan on time and in full without any delays. And now for her 14th cycle she is borrowing Php 10,000 that she intends to use to buy an additional computer box and as start-up capital for a mini grocery store, and "batchoyan" (an eatery that sells the ilonggo noodle dish). In the picture Virginia in shown posing in front of her computer gaming place.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy adiitional computer box and put up mini groceries

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani sells fire wood at the corner of his house in Ibadan.He has been in the business for quite a long time. He is hoping to expand this business. He hopes for a loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase additional fire wood to sell. He says thanks to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fire wood to sell

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita C. is from Sitio Tuburan. She is 48 years old and is married with four school age children. Mrs. C. saw the rising needs of her family and wanted to help her husband in sustaining their needs. At that point in time she thought of making pots and selling them to her neighbors and some were displayed on the roadside where motorists could see her products. Because of her creativeness in making pots, some of her customers ordered them in bulk so that they could also resell them to neighboring communities.

Leonita aims to give her family a better and comfortable life. Now, Mrs. C. applied for PHP 17,000 loan which she intends to invest in her pottery business as additional capital.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en:
Yemisi sells foodstuffs in front of her house in Ibadan and she has been in this business for a long time. She is 49 years old and married with five children.

Yemisi hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells plastic goods in the market and has been in the business for the past seventeen years. She is 50 years old and married with six children.

Esther hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more plastic goods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic goods to sell

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato P., who lives in the village of Sitio Tuburan, Barangay Camba-og, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, is 33 years old and single, but he has a fiancée whom he plans to marry when all the wedding arrangements have been made. Renato is the 5th child of twelve siblings and he is taking care of his mother. To support his parents and prepare for his future, Renato engaged in a pig-fattening business, and he has two productive sows today. All the piglets of the two sows were sold and the income he obtained was used to buy additional pig feed and even vitamins for the sows. It was also used to help support his family expenses, and most especially his mother. Renato found out that he needed additional capital to expand his business and to support the needs of his business. In 2004 he became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and was able to obtain a loan for his business needs. His business improved because of the loan and he was able to add more piglets to raise and sell. And, as the amount he could borrow increased because of his good credit record, he was able to improve his business facilities and was able to earn PHP 4,000 per month, which was enough to sustain his business, support himself and his mother, and set aside some amount for his future family. For his previous loan, Renato borrowed Php 14,000 which he used as additional working capital for his business. The said loan amount was repaid in weekly installments and was fully repaid on time and without any delays. That’s why he is planning for his 10th loan to borrow the same amount. It will be used to purchase additional livestock to raise and to sell and whatever income arises from it will be used to improve and expand his business even further. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia tiene 21 años y actualmente está casada. Ambos tiene un hermoso bebe de 1 año. La señora Lidia trabaja en la producción de  la leche cruda, también se dedica a la agricultura cultiva  aba, maíz y alfa alfa  para el consumo de su ganado. Ella trabaja con las vacas mientras  el marido  trabaja  en el trópico de enfermero.

La señora Lidia vive en la comunidad de Sorata en la ciudad de Cochabamba, no tiene casa propia, vive con la madre. Tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero con las cuales produce leche para luego venderla  a una persona particular para la  elaboración de productos lácteos.

Este préstamo será destinado  para la compra de una cabeza de ganado  lechero,  de esta manera incrementara su producción de leche, lo cual significa aumentar el nivel de ingreso y mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y del niño. Ella sueña con aumentar   su producción y  ofrecerle una vivienda, educación y un mejor nivel  de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Lidia is 21 years old, married, and the mother of a beautiful, on-year-old baby. She works as a raw milk dairy farmer and also farms flat beans, corn, and alfalfa to feed her cattle. She works with the cows while her husband works as a nurse in the tropics. Lidia lives in the Sorata community in the city of Cochabamba. She doesn't own her own home; she lives with her mother. She has 3 cows that produce the milk which she sells to a private person who then produces the dairy products. This loan will be used to buy another cow so that she can increase the quantity of milk produced which, in turn, will raise her income thereby improving her and her baby's quality of life. Her dream is to increase milk production and to offer her child a home, education, and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lekan

texts.en:
Lekan is 29 years old and married with a child. He sells motor parts in the market and has been in the business for the past seven years. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State.

Lekan hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor parts to sell

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en: Falilatu is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She sells bunches of plantains in the market. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira (or about $350 US) to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantains to sell.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 64-year-old married father of four. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1995 and has been involved in this industry for 20 years. Today, Sami is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married mother of two children ages 7 and 9. Both of her children attend school. She resides and owns a two-room house which she shares with four people. Rose takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but lacks piped water. 

Rose owns a stall selling food like bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes in Naguru. She does not pay rent on the stall, but pays monthly market dues and operation license fees. She works in the outskirts of Kampala, Uganda. Rose has been in this business for ten years with MCDT. She does not pay transport costs to and from the market. Her challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing cost of foodstuffs. Rose wants to use this loan to buy more goods to sell. She hopes to seeher business grow stronger so she can start buying from farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Legitimas Group

texts.es:
Legítimas es un grupo de 9 mujeres y un varón y son  alegres y dinámicas, se agruparon recientemente por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les perM. ampliar sus negocios, uno de los integrantes es Williams, él tiene el negocio de venta de ropa, se animó a ingresar a el grupo porque su esposa ya trabaja con Pro Mujer en otro grupo y le va muy bien. Williams desea incrementar su mercadería  comprando nuevos fardos de ropa y para bajar  el costo  él viaja a Oruro (departamento de Bolivia), para lo cual necesita el préstamo, además Williams es padre de 2 niñas.
Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios que en su mayoría es la confección y venta de ropa y necesitan el préstamo algunas para comprar mercadería y otras para adquirir materia prima.
texts.en:
Legítimas is a group of 9 women and one man who are cheerful and dynamic. They recently came together to raise capital that will allow them to enlarge their businesses. One of the members is Williams who sells clothing. He was encouraged to join the group because his wife already works with Pro Mujer in another group and she does quite well. Williams wants buy new bundles of clothes to increase his inventory . To reduce costs, he travels to Oruro (Bolivia department), for which he needs this loan. Williams is the father of two daughters. The other members of the group also have their own activities which, for the most part, consist in making and selling clothing and some members need the funds to purchase merchandise and others to purchase raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock inventory, supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee M. is 39 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 18. She and her family live in Nyamata district, Eastern Province, Rwanda, where her business is located.

Josee has been a successful entrepreneur since 1999 – 10 years! She works by herself in this business with no employees or helpers.

Josee is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business of making soft drinks from sorghum, by purchasing needed materials as well as providing necessary working capital. All of this, she projects, will help her to earn more profit.

With this profit, she will be able to obtain more food for her family and save money for buying her own house some day, as well as to continue to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making sorghum soft drinks

loans.name: Rouba

texts.en: Rouba is a single woman living with her parents. She is 25 years old. Rouba has been working as a garden arranger since 2005 to earn income to improve her living conditions. Today, Rouba is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy new tools to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy new tools for her gardening business.

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Juana is a 68-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Juana is the coordinator for her group, Cristo Redentor (Christ the Redeemer), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Juana and her husband live in Batey Victorina, a small community north of San Pedro. Bateyes are small communities built by sugar companies for their workers. Juana’s batey is particularly remote and difficult to reach: when visiting the community, our 4x4 truck was barely able to make it all the way there. The batey also lacks electricity, potable water, and any kind of healthcare service.

Despite these difficulties, Juana runs a successful pica pollo, or fried chicken stand. Fried chicken is one of the most popular foods here, and every town has at least one. Juana will use her loan to purchase supplies for her stand. This is Juana’s fifth loan with Esperanza, and she has a perfect repayment record. She has said that Esperanza has provided a new door to the future for her family, and that her dreams for her children have come true because of the support Esperanza has provided. Thank you for lending to Juana and the Cristo Redentor group!

loans.use: Chicken, oil, and flour

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 52-year-old widow who has been working as a home-based tailor since 1979. While she has for years been able to meet her needs through her business, Fatmeh is now seeking to borrow $900 USD to purchase additional textiles to be able to produce a broader range of products to satisfy the requirements of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles
